Mental Assault.name: Blood Lords
Mental Assault.description: Magic sigils @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} in the grain of the wooden door trigger a magic trap that damages the mind of anyone attempting to pick the door's lock.
Mental Assault.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:48] (legendary) to deface the symbols or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (10th level, counteract DC 48) to counteract the trap.
Mental Assault.hazardReset: The trap resets automatically if triggered and doesn't reset if disabled.

Night's Breath Trap.name: Blood Lords
Night's Breath Trap.description: The night giant mummy unfolds its arms and leans forward to exhale a blast of gray mist and shrieking spirits into the room.
Night's Breath Trap.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:33] to "blind" the statue so that it cannot notice any who approach, @Check[type:occultism|dc:35] to redirect and expend the trap's occult energies harmlessly, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th level, counteract DC 32) to counteract the trap.
Night's Breath Trap.hazardReset: The trap resets during the following round, after which it can be triggered again.

Ghoul Antipaladin.name: Ghoul Antipaladin
Ghoul Antipaladin.description: The church of Kabriri selects only the most devoted and deadly ghouls to protect their libraries of secret-filled tomes.

0lWpDMSeWHOeidNI.name: Destructive Vengeance
0lWpDMSeWHOeidNI.description:
Trigger The ghoul antipaladin takes damage from an enemy within 15 feet

Effect The ghoul antipaladin increases the amount of damage they take by [[/r 3d6]], and they deal 3d6 damage to the triggering enemy, choosing evil or negative damage to deal to the enemy each time the antipaladin uses this reaction. In addition, the antipaladin deals [[/r 4]]]{4 extra Damage} of the chosen type with their Strikes against the triggering creature until the end of the antipaladin's turn. An enemy damaged from the ghoul antipaladin's Destructive Vengeance also takes [[/r 4[persistent,evil]]] damage; this applies only to the damage the reaction itself deals to the triggering creature, not the damage the antipaladin deals with subsequent Strikes.

0LawcBuLq6bvz3YR.name: Consume Flesh
0LawcBuLq6bvz3YR.description:
Requirements The ghoul antipaladin is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour

Effect The ghoul antipaladin devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r 4d6[healing]]]{4d6 Hit Points}. It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

o61qEO77xsq1zS2N.name: Ghoul Fever
o61qEO77xsq1zS2N.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:27]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r 2d6[negative]]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r 2d6[negative]]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

qxLcM4LwcXIOI4JT.name: Paralysis
qxLcM4LwcXIOI4JT.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul antipaladin's attack must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. The creature can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

B3ANiSJpKPeKx484.name: Swift Leap
B3ANiSJpKPeKx484.description: The ghoul antipaladin jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Ghoul Razorclaw.name: Ghoul Razorclaw
Ghoul Razorclaw.description: Ghoul assassins who survive dipping their claws in molten adamantine transform into razorclaws.

QpRhJboLIrPLkeJI.name: Deny Advantage
QpRhJboLIrPLkeJI.description: The razorclaw isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} to creatures of 13th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking, or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.w6rMqmGzhUahdnA7]{Surprise Attack}.

qmMIJCw0r4JFDq1n.name: Adamantine Edges
qmMIJCw0r4JFDq1n.description: The ghoul's claws have been dipped in adamantine. The razorclaw treats any object they hit with a claw Strike as if it had half as much Hardness and any creature they hit as if they had half as much physical resistance.

5JJOaC8DhIMUfGvU.name: Consume Flesh
5JJOaC8DhIMUfGvU.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r 7d6[healing]]]{7d6 Hit Points} .

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

uaypwbmMrRqxLWbM.name: Ghoul Fever
uaypwbmMrRqxLWbM.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:31]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r 4d6[negative]]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r 4d6[negative]]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

FD08rlVq7IYngy5F.name: Paralysis
FD08rlVq7IYngy5F.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:31] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

NC1LlhP87iNkiYlz.description:
The ghoul razorclaw deals an extra 3d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

j2SKJWI2rOeIZs43.name: Surprise Attacker
j2SKJWI2rOeIZs43.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} to the ghoul razorclaw.

fCYACagEutwMx2Qk.name: Swift Leap
fCYACagEutwMx2Qk.description: The ghoul razorclaw jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Pyrogeist.name: Pyrogeist
Pyrogeist.description: Born from the deaths of arsonists who died in the fires they started, pyrogeists are roiling infernos whose spectral fire emits no actual heat and harms only living creatures. Obsessed with sharing their torment with the living, pyrogeists haunt the area of their demise until whatever wrong they refuse to forgive has been righted, and they are finally put to rest. While pyrogeists can't set their own fires, they often use their terrifying illusory capabilities and telekinetic powers to lure their victims into setting themselves ablaze.

hUrIdt4350dOmm6i.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Positive

a98WQBZnrw05bkW0.name: Rejuvenation
a98WQBZnrw05bkW0.description: When a pyrogeist is destroyed, it reforms where it was destroyed after [[/br 2d4 #Days]]{2d4 days}, fully healed. The pyrogeist can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

f3rhcLIKuURVP0jS.name: Breath Weapon
f3rhcLIKuURVP0jS.description: A pyrogeist can spit a cone of spectral fire in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30], dealing [[/r 10d6[negative]]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:29|basic:true]). A creature that fails the save also takes [[/r 1d6[persistent,negative]]] damage and is subject to the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire} until the persistent damage ends.

CvzsTrIxfGzyc75Q.name: Pyrokinetic Whirlwind
CvzsTrIxfGzyc75Q.description: The pyrogeist transforms into a 40-foot tall vortex of spectral flame that appears to immolate everything within a @Template[type:burst|distance:10]. A creature within this area take [[/r (2d12 + 20)[negative]]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:29|basic:true]).

hbGonvqkjN6EsLXx.name: Soul Consumption
hbGonvqkjN6EsLXx.description: The spirit of a creature that dies from damage dealt by the pyrogeist's Pyrokinetic Whirlwind is trapped within the pyrogeist as if subjected to the effects of the bind soul spell. This effect persists until the pyrogeist is destroyed or chooses to set the soul free. The spirit remains trapped whether or not the pyrogeist is using Pyrokinetic Whirlwind. A pyrogeist can contain only one soul at a time in this manner.

Arboreal Snag (Axan Wood).name: Arboreal Snag (Axan Wood)
Arboreal Snag (Axan Wood).description:
Arboreals can be victims of undeath like any other living creature, but without bones or flesh, their undead take a different form. When an arboreal shivers to life as undead, it often animates as a snag-a leafless, skeletal dead tree that haunts its forest, attacking any living creature it can catch. An arboreal snag is mindless and difficult to control, but some necromancers use them as forest guardians.

While many arboreals are comfortable remaining still for prolonged periods of time, arboreal snags tend to be restless, meandering in a region they consider their domain. This territory is sometimes evident from battered forest animals or trampled undergrowth that litters the ground, but forest creatures soon learn to avoid the area entirely. It doesn't take long for regions haunted by arboreal snags to grow desolate and unhealthy, and locals often dub such regions as haunted or cursed.

sLbK87e5VN9NxmkM.name: Blood Roots
sLbK87e5VN9NxmkM.description: The snag's roots go deep into corpses buried beneath and around it. It has regeneration 5 (deactivated by positive) as long as it remains in an area where corpses are buried.

GOVDOv9MOM61figq.name: Axe Vulnerability
GOVDOv9MOM61figq.description: An arboreal snag takes [[/r 5]]{5 additional Damage} from axes.

Rotbomber.name: Rotbomber
Rotbomber.description: Disgusting and dangerous, rotbombers bound around on all four limbs, ripping off the pressurized and explosive necrotic pustules that grow out of their backs to lob them toward their enemies. When they explode, the pustules emit concussive blasts of force and deadly pestilence that can infect a victim. Though slow and overburdened by the intense weight of the pustules, rotbombers can move with a surprising speed when they need to hunt down their quarry.

H6hMLXf28bLOOjsy.name: Slow
H6hMLXf28bLOOjsy.description: A rotbomber is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

q5DQX31tD4pldcTg.name: Pressurized Pustules
q5DQX31tD4pldcTg.description: When a rotbomber takes acid, fire, physical or sonic damage, there is a chance a prematurely developed pustule bursts open, determined by a @Check[type:flat|dc:11]. All creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] must succeed at @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}. A creature that gets a critical failure becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}. Any creature who attempts this save becomes temporarily immune to pressurized pustules for 24 hours.

06qMU7kYZDHHRKSo.name: Gaseous Smash
06qMU7kYZDHHRKSo.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The rotbomber pulls two necrotic pustules from its body, one in each hand, and leaps into the air in an attempt to detonate them simultaneously on a hapless victim. The rotbomber Leaps up to 15 feet horizontally and 10 feet vertically to land in a square adjacent to a target creature and makes a necrotic pustule Strike against the target. If the Strike hits, it deals an additional [[/r 4d6[bludgeoning]]] damage to the target. This counts as two attacks for the purposes of determining the rotbomber's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not increase until after the Gaseous Smash.

4aM9vFLoPyyxbgSF.name: Necrotic Rot
4aM9vFLoPyyxbgSF.description:
Necrotic rot withers and corrupts living tissue at an alarming rate. An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from necrotic rot until it has been cured of the disease.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29]

Stage 1 [[/r 2d6[negative]]] damage (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}

Stage 3 [[/r 3d6[negative]]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}

Stage 4 dead, rising as a rotbomber immediately

5KPDnYNQ8pvieHTT.name: Propulsive Pestilence
5KPDnYNQ8pvieHTT.description: The pressurized necrotic gases within the rotbomber's pustules make them explode far more dramatically than most alchemists' bombs. The rotbomber's necrotic pustules deal splash damage to every creature within 15 feet of the target.

nqI6MSL3fFcCZoYB.name: Circling Assault
nqI6MSL3fFcCZoYB.description: The corpsekiller circles around their target then attacks, throwing their foe off balance and puncturing its defenses. The corpsekiller Steps or Strides, then attempts a glaive Strike. On a hit or critical hit, the Strike ignores 10 of their target's resistances. Regardless of the result of the Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} for 1 round.

KJypjv7i8jsU0cW5.name: Corpsekiller
KJypjv7i8jsU0cW5.description: A corpsekiller's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures as though etched with a ghost touch property rune and deal an additional [[/r 2d8[slashing]]] damage to undead creatures.

Straugh.name: Straugh
Straugh.description: When skirmishes break out between tunneling ghouls and creatures that dwell beneath the surface of Golarion, there's a chance that ghoul fever could infect such animals, producing strange new variants of ghoul beasts. However, letting the natural corruption run its course sometimes results in unsatisfying monsters, so some necromancers speed the process. This is the situation that led to the creation of the first straugh. A priest of Kabriri made the monstrosity to defend a claimed cemetery from another sect of ghouls who were preying upon the interred bodies. In some places, ghouls use straughs to tunnel into rival warrens or highly fortified mausoleums.

U8KzgRL97wTZHRzW.name: Consume Flesh
U8KzgRL97wTZHRzW.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r 7d6[healing]]]{7d6 Hit Points}.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

3ALLpVbvOIjvYxoz.name: Fetid Screech
3ALLpVbvOIjvYxoz.description:
Unaware that its vocal organs have withered and decayed, the straugh instinctively but ineffectively attempts to screech, instead releasing malodorous gas, half-digested corpse flesh, and small swarms of maggots from its open beak. The straugh releases a disgusting cloud of gas and decaying detritus in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15]; any creature within the area must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}. On a critical failure, the creature also takes a -5 foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. Any creature that succeeds at the save is temporarily immune to Fetid Screech for 24 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.lIEc8Lx3ROm17Dqa]{Effect: Fetid Screech (Critical Failure)}

04iwDHWYCbKI46bP.name: Ghoul Fever
04iwDHWYCbKI46bP.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r 4d8[negative]]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r 4d8[negative]]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

Oi10YnqeymdtqRHt.name: Paralysis
Oi10YnqeymdtqRHt.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Rtm8o7JzZF50M8BC.name: Rock Tunneler
Rtm8o7JzZF50M8BC.description: A straugh can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 10 feet. It can leave a tunnel if it desires, and it usually does.

Hn6X5wYdDhrMum8O.name: Tunneling Strike
Hn6X5wYdDhrMum8O.description:
Requirements The straugh has Burrowed underground and remains undetected by the creature it plans to attack

Effect The straugh Burrows twice to emerge from the ground adjacent to at least one enemy and immediately makes a Strike against that foe.

c89WP8wLt3Svnyq3.name: Bolster Dead
c89WP8wLt3Svnyq3.description:
Frequency once per turn

Requirements Your most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip necromancy spell

Effect You harness the residual energy from the spell you last cast into the body of an undead creature within 30 feet. That creature's resistances increase by an amount equal to the level of the spell cast until the beginning of the next turn.

bODMkF6HiQEvjnaj.name: Drain Bonded Item
bODMkF6HiQEvjnaj.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The necromancer hasn't acted yet on this turn

Effect The necromancer expends the power stored in their dagger. This gives them the ability to cast one prepared spell they prepared today and already cast, without spending a spell slot.

Princess Kerinza.name: Princess Kerinza
Princess Kerinza.description:
Soulbound dolls are eerie mannequins or playthings that have been imbued with a small piece of a deceased mortal's soul. These little constructs are created for a variety of reasons-such as to serve as companions or servants-but their free will means their obedience to their creators is hardly a given. Followers of Pharasma generally abhor soulbound dolls, viewing them as a perversion of the natural cycle of souls, and those who worship the Lady of Graves see the destruction of a soulbound doll, regardless of the construct's alignment, as an important service to the Great Beyond. Soulbound dolls are the simplest in a series of soulbound constructs including human-sized soulbound mannequins, powerful soulbound shells, and sentinel soulbound terra-cotta warriors. Creating them from unwilling living creatures is evil, and an unwilling donor can resist the process with a successful Will save against the creator's Craft DC, ruining the doll if not preventing the donor's death. A non-evil doll can only be crafted from the soul of a person who has given consent to such use before their death occurred

Soulbound dolls encountered by adventurers are typically guardians of some sort; despite their diminutive size, the soul fragment's power makes the doll's flst more dangerous than a casual observer would expect. Further, it grants the doll a single spell of outsized power given its stature. Because of their autonomy and remarkable intelligence, soulbound dolls are occasionally employed by their crafters as administrators over much more powerful but mindless constructs such as golems, allowing such dolls to control defenses far beyond their own capabilities. Though soulbound dolls contain a small fragment of a soul extracted during or shortly after a person's death, this doesn't affect the deceased's resurrection or progress to the afterlife. This extraction process is lethal to otherwise-living prospective soul donors, though there are rumors of more expensive processes that allows someone to donate a fragment of a living soul without repercussions.

The soul fragment resides in a soul focus gem typically embedded in the doll's neck or chest. The soul fragment isn't static, and the doll continues to learn from its initial state, meaning its personality and abilities can change, possibly growing closer to the donor's or moving farther afield on its own individual path. The soulbound doll's focus gem retains the doll's memories even after the doll's destruction. The the intact soul focus gem of a destroyed doll can even be placed into a new doll body by someone knowledgeable in the creation of soulbound creatures, effectively reconstituting the soulbound doll.

yQZhpnGLdofg8nwo.name: Skeleton Key That is Also the Key to Area F10

0qLV4XXhIJyka38A.name: Personality Fragments
0qLV4XXhIJyka38A.description: The Kerinza doll is animated by a piece of Kerinza's soul, energized by the happiest time in her life. She can telepathically communicate with the Doriel doll as long as they're within 60 feet of each other. If the Doriel doll is defeated, her eyes turn black, and black veins run beneath her porcelain skin. She can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.GaRQlC9Yw1BGKHfN]{Crushing Despair} again if she's already cast it, and she can cast it as a single action.

VMY4BFNvsVHx85It.description:
Princess Kerinza deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Padh4azq1HtiVrHg.name: Surprise Attack
Padh4azq1HtiVrHg.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} to Princess Kerinza.

Matron Uldrula.name: Matron Uldrula
Matron Uldrula.description:
Shokis are shepherds who lead wayward souls to the Boneyard.

Psychopomps preside over death and the cycle of souls.

oDr6qqRzR4QVrczZ.name: Plane Shift (Self And Locked Soul Only, To The Boneyard Only)

uKVihdZh10f60zxY.name: Shard Shield
uKVihdZh10f60zxY.description:
Trigger A creature targets Matron Uldrula with an attack

Requirements Matron Uldrula has been reduced to 150 Hit Points or fewer

Effect The fragments of Matron Uldrula, sheared off from her form during this encounter, fly through the air, interposing themselves between Matron Uldrula and harm. Matron Uldrula gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

BvSY2UcdIiDeZpPO.name: Soul Shards
BvSY2UcdIiDeZpPO.description: When Matron Uldrula is wounded, tiny fragments of her break away, littering the floor with glass-like shards. In their place, glimmering gold cracks crisscross Matron Uldrula's form, each hard as steel. When Matron Uldrula is reduced to 150 Hit Points or fewer, she gains resistance 10 to all physical damage, as her body becomes more gold than flesh.

MVJzWbiRIqCaCA3v.name: Infuse Staff
MVJzWbiRIqCaCA3v.description: Matron Uldrula's staff is her symbol of office and gains a measure of her personal power. This staff becomes a +2 greater striking staff and is treated as if it were adamantine while Matron Uldrula wields it. Matron Uldrula's staff has Hardness 17 and HP 68 (BT 34) while possessed by her, or Hardness 5 and HP 20 (BT 10) while out of her possession. If her staff is taken or destroyed, Matron Uldrula can infuse a new one with an hour of work.

3ZCQLxhf1lgCinva.name: Soul Lock
3ZCQLxhf1lgCinva.description:
Requirements Matron Uldrula doesn't have a soul locked within her staff

Effect Matron Uldrula attempts to capture the soul of a creature on the brink of death, either an undead creature or a creature with the dying condition. The target must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:46] save with the following results.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune to Soul Lock.

Success Matron Uldrula's staff tugs at the creature's soul but doesn't trap it. If the creature is living, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} (or increases its doomed condition by 1). If the creature is a corporeal undead, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}. If the creature is an incorporeal undead, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}. The creature then becomes temporarily immune to soul lock for 24 hours.

Failure Matron Uldrula locks the creature's soul in her staff. If the creature is living, it dies. If the creature is a corporeal undead, its body becomes an inanimate corpse. If the creature is an incorporeal undead, it becomes bodily trapped within the staff. While the soul is locked in the staff, the target can't be returned to life or undeath, or rejuvenated through any means, save powerful magic, such as miracle or wish, or through divine intervention. If Matron Uldrula's staff is destroyed or she wills it, the soul is released. Matron Uldrula's staff can only hold one soul at a time.

May8pisi3prNRNuU.name: Spirit Touch
May8pisi3prNRNuU.description: Matron Uldrula's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a ghost touch property rune and deal [[/r 4d6[negative]]] damage to living creatures and [[/r 4d6[positive]]] damage to undead.

Terrorguard.name: Terrorguard
Terrorguard.description: Spellcasters who harness the power of the Dimension of Dreams may use it to fuel vicious servitors known as terrorguards-hulking terrors adorned with frames made of an Abysium alloy. Terrorguards come in many forms; creators often design the constructs' frames to mimic grotesque aberrations by mixing-and-matching parts.

3GMuYwRCpwabX2Jv.name: Breath of Phantasms
3GMuYwRCpwabX2Jv.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The terrorguard's ram-skull head opens at the jaw, allowing a horde of swirling phantasms to escape from its maw in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Each creature in the area is subjected to a 5th-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.tlcrVRqW1MSKJ5IC]{Phantasmal Killer} spell (@Check[type:will|dc:31], @Check[type:fortitude|dc:31|traits:incapacitation]).

TI32SCeXh4AwiTF3.name: Draw the Line
TI32SCeXh4AwiTF3.description: A terrorguard plunges its dreamscythe into the ground and rends a glowing line across the surface that reverberates with the essence of the Dimension of Dreams. Chose up to four unoccupied squares which are adjacent to one another and adjacent to the terrorguard. For [[/br 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, any creature besides the terrorguard who enters such a square must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:31] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 4} as they behold grotesque visions from the nightmare realm. A creature that succeeds at this save is temporarily immune to the effect for 24 hours.

ZCE0MMUew9kQ0v3t.name: Nightmare Essence
ZCE0MMUew9kQ0v3t.description: A creature damaged by a terrorguard's dreamscythe hallucinates that the environment and creatures around them have transformed into a hellscape reminiscent of their most horrifying dreams. A creature hit with a dreamscythe Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:31] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round. A creature who succeeds at this save is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

6Ku9JLx9tFrA39RI.name: Skull Charge
6Ku9JLx9tFrA39RI.description: The terrorguard Strides twice in a straight line and then makes a horn Strike with a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.

Mummy Valet.name: Mummy Valet
Mummy Valet.description:
The majority of mummies were created by cruel and selfish masters to serve as guardians to protect their tombs from intruders. The traditional method of creating a mummy guardian is a laborious and sadistic process that begins well before the poor soul to be transformed is dead, during which the victim is ritualistically starved of nourishing food and instead fed strange spices, preservative agents, and toxins intended to quicken the desiccation of the flesh. The victim remains immobile but painfully aware during the final stages, where its now-useless entrails are extracted before it's shrouded in funerary wrappings and entombed within a necromantically ensorcelled sarcophagus to await intrusions in the potentially distant future. While it's certainly possible to use other methods to create a mummy guardian from an already-deceased body, those who seek to create these foul undead as their guardians in the afterlife often feel that such methods result in inferior undead-the pain and agony of death by mummification being an essential step in the process.

Regardless of the method of their creation, mummy guardians are more than just physical shells of flesh and bone-they retain fragmented, distorted versions of their minds, with only enough memories of their living personality remaining to fuel their undead anger and jealousy of those who yet live. This burning rage only intensifies over the centuries of waiting within a crypt for the chance to actually act, and thus when most mummy guardians are awoken by tomb robbers or adventurers, they stop at nothing in pursuit of glorious slaughter.

While many cultures practice mummification of the dead for benign reasons, undead mummies are created through foul rituals, typically to provide eternally vigilant guardians.

id0Lj5zD5tQaYREF.name: Subtle Presence
id0Lj5zD5tQaYREF.description: The mummy valet activates or deactivates its despair aura.

1ich4lSlipgnuhyC.name: Despair
1ich4lSlipgnuhyC.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Living creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} while in a mummy guardian's despair aura. They can't naturally recover from this fear while in the area but recover instantly once they leave the area. When a creature first enters the area, it must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:22] save (after taking the penalty from being frightened) or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round. The creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.1bOSJ2LbEC28aI9f]{Effect: Despair}

kGKrPttfeXrnHGWr.name: Mummy Rot
kGKrPttfeXrnHGWr.description:
This disease and any damage from it can't be healed until this curse is removed. A creature killed by mummy rot turns to dust and can't be resurrected except by a 7th-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual or similar magic.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 minute)

Stage 2 [[/r 4d6[negative]]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Crystallized Agony.name: Blood Lords
Crystallized Agony.description: A violet crystal containing the body of a dead creature, grown from its dying agony, pulses as it exudes motes of flickering energy.
Crystallized Agony.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:33] (master) or @Check[type:survival|dc:35] (master) to know where to Strike a specific crystal perfectly on a facet to cause it to shatter harmlessly
Crystallized Agony.hazardReset: A crystallized agony resets automatically and can be triggered again the next round.

fs49A2QDgfg74MTh.name: Independent Brains
fs49A2QDgfg74MTh.description: Each of Sulvik's heads rolls its own initiative and has its own turn. Neither head can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.A72nHGUtNXgY5Ey9]{Delay}. At the start of a head's turn, that head gets 2 actions and 1 reaction. Each brain controls its own tongue and one of Sulvik's arms, but both can move the legs. Any ability that would sever Sulvik's head (such as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.6xaxxKfvXED6LfIY]{Vorpal} weapon property) doesn't cause him to die if he has his other head, but does cause him to lose the turns, actions, and reactions of the severed head. Mental effects that target a single creature affect only one of Sulvik's heads.

ryu97a9Y75S5GuK0.name: Mohrg Spawn
ryu97a9Y75S5GuK0.description: When Sulvik kills a living creature of 8th level or less, that creature rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.OaNtHZAraCrVLuSo]{Mohrg} after [[/br 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, on its turn. This mohrg spawn is under Sulvik's command. If Sulvik is destroyed, the mohrg spawn is destroyed as well, immediately collapsing into a pile of decayed flesh and bones.

stXfg5Sba6tjjP5Z.name: Paralysis
stXfg5Sba6tjjP5Z.description: A living creature hit by Sulvik's tongue Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. The creature can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each attempt.

Hungry Cottage.name: Blood Lords
Hungry Cottage.description: Iron Taviah's cottage comes to life and tries to eat everyone in it. The hazard is divided into three areas: the basement becomes the cottage's stomach; the stairs act as the cottage's throat, becoming a steep, slippery incline that is greater difficult terrain; and the ground floor is the inside of the cottage's mouth. Creatures within the cottage can move around within it but can't exit without pulling the mouth open or slipping out while its teeth gnash. Characters who successfully escape the cottage are safe from the hazard.
Hungry Cottage.hazardDisable: The hungry cottage can't be damaged or disabled, but the danger in each area can be temporarily mitigated. In the stomach: @Check[type:athletics|dc:17|traits:action:climb] (trained) to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} atop the hoarded belongings and avoid contact with the acidic walls or floor for 1 round, or @Check[type:crafting|dc:25] (expert) as a 2-action activity to concoct an alchemical antacid that neutralizes acid damage dealt by the stomach for [[/br 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. In the throat: @Check[type:athletics|dc:23] (trained) to hold the throat open for one round, allowing all characters in the stairs to use a Reflex save result one degree of success greater than their roll to avoid being pushed into the stomach, or @Check[type:nature|dc:23] or Survival as a 2-action activity to ease the throat's contractions and provide the same effect for [[/br 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. In the mouth: @Check[type:athletics|dc:22|traits:action:force-open] to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Force Open} a window or a door and forcibly expel one creature that's within 10 feet of an exit from the cottage, or @Check[type:athletics|dc:25] (expert) as a 2-action activity to jam furniture in place that prevents the teeth from gnashing for [[/br 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds} and allows anyone in the cottage to move from it during that time.
Hungry Cottage.hazardReset: Once no creatures remain in the cottage, the hazard resets and returns to a normal cottage. The stairs and the basement are gone, however, as is Iron Taviah's body.
Hungry Cottage.hazardRoutine: The cursed cottage uses 3 actions: Acidic Assault in the stomach, Swallowing Staircase in the throat, and Gnashing Portal in the mouth (in that order). Checks to disable the areas might prevent these actions for a brief time.

Intellect Assemblage.name: Intellect Assemblage
Intellect Assemblage.description: Intellect assemblages are artificial constructs created from the memories of others. These memories are solidified into jagged shards similar in appearance to shattered glass and fused together in vaguely humanoid-shaped clusters to create the assemblage's body. The resulting construct is incredibly intelligent but completely devoid of emotion, possessing the thoughts and memories of a multitude but no personal connection to any of them. Analytical and meticulous, intellect assemblages view the world and everything in it as parts of a complex equation or system. They place no value on life or morality and consider emotions an illogical weakness.

hAQUQuH4rotLGV93.name: Bardic Lore
hAQUQuH4rotLGV93.description: Intellect assemblages are created from the thoughts and memories of hundreds of individuals, providing them a near limitless collection of data to pull from. Intellect assemblages have access to Bardic Lore, a special Lore skill allowing them to Recall Knowledge on any topic.

lkeLIkdbCDGg9ina.name: Fascinating Facets
lkeLIkdbCDGg9ina.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The thought shards composing the intellect assemblage's body reflect countless memories, thoughts, and dreams. A creature that starts its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:38] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} with the intellect assemblage for 1 round. An intellect assemblage can suppress or activate this aura as a single action with the concentrate trait.

nF1EJh2Wj3EzO8jZ.name: Meticulous
nF1EJh2Wj3EzO8jZ.description: An intellect assemblage is analytical. Whenever they fail a saving throw against a mental spell or effect, the intellect assemblage is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/br 1d4 #Slowed Duration]]{1d4 rounds} as they sift through the new information.

hHpTOf0Sei8VSKd5.name: Invasive Thoughts
hHpTOf0Sei8VSKd5.description: When the intellect assemblage gets a critical hit with a fist or memory shard Strike, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for [[/br 1d4 #Confusion Duration]]{1d4 rounds}, as the memories stored in the assemblage's thought shards overwhelm the target's psyche.

Hyrune Loxenna.name: Hyrune Loxenna
Hyrune Loxenna.npcHp: coffin restoration, fast healing 15, negative healing

tlhZIlTIzio9uf0p.name: Hungerfang
tlhZIlTIzio9uf0p.description:
A long metal shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used oneâ€‘handed as a melee weapon and can be thrown.

Currently contains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.DCQHaLrYXMI37dvW]{Paralyze}

iLV83KWLAubvTCHR.name: Children of the Deep
iLV83KWLAubvTCHR.description: Hyrune's presence brings forth creatures of the deep to do his bidding. These typically include bat swarms, giant spiders, and giant centipedes, but can include other Darklands creatures. Hyrune can give telepathic orders to these creatures as long as they are within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.

5ynSyNxRrPYLHX2S.name: Divided Faith
5ynSyNxRrPYLHX2S.description: Hyrune's devotion to Urgathoa has become undermined by his obsession with Orgesh. Urgathoa's religious symbol can be brandished at Hyrune to trigger his revulsion, provided the person attempting to do so accuses Hyrune of being a heretic or of betraying his faith. Hyrune takes a -2 circumstance penalty to Will saves to overcome this revulsion.

uLe70a80LVMuUEbe.name: Change Shape
uLe70a80LVMuUEbe.description:
The vampire transforms into one of its animal forms or back into its normal form. Most vampires can turn into a bat, but some can turn into a different creature, such as a rat or a wolf.

Use the options in the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.NzXpEzcZAjuDTZjK]{Aerial Form} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.wp09USMB3GIW1qbp]{Animal Form} spells as guidelines.

  • Bat The vampire changes into a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.VAWmwDA08ZLQd8lW]{Bat Swarm} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.C9s5tBxVValC2HTE]{Giant Bat}. It gains echolocation 40 feet, a land Speed of 20 feet and a fly Speed of 30 feet, and a fangs Strike with a +28 attack modifier. These fangs deal 3d12+16 piercing damage.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

TOYsFGjZBmCRAaeI.name: Create Spawn
TOYsFGjZBmCRAaeI.description:
If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, the vampire can turn this victim into a vampire by donating some of its own blood to the victim and burying the victim in earth for 3 nights.

If the new vampire is lower level than its creator, it is under the creator's control. If a vampire controls too many spawn at once (as determined by the GM), strong-willed spawn can free themselves by succeeding at a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.saves.will.value)|name:Escape Thralldom] saving throw against the vampire's Will DC.

LgxpkMfCAPjEi1eg.name: Dominate
LgxpkMfCAPjEi1eg.description:
The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait. The save DC uses the DC of the vampire's level, and a creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

qz6WlJm5c1QTYtA8.name: Drink Blood
qz6WlJm5c1QTYtA8.description:
Requirement A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an Athletics check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the vampire regains [[/r 22[healing]]]{22 Hit Points}, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[type:medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

yjzcKHxxLILIkpm9.name: Familiar
yjzcKHxxLILIkpm9.description: Hyrune's familiar is Taulzhalotel, a one-eyed, long-tailed hairless bat with a fly speed of 25 feet, darkvision, manual dexterity (with its tail), speech, and spell delivery.

2xCy48XLd52czdWX.name: Gluttonous Gulp
2xCy48XLd52czdWX.description: Hyrune dislocates his jaw to open his mouth far wider than it should, growing a thicket of additional fangs as he does. He attempts a fangs Strike and deals an additional [[/r 3d6[piercing]]] damage on a successful hit and can attempt to Drink Blood if he as an action remaining, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus on his Athletics check to do so.

Drowned Mummy.name: Drowned Mummy
Drowned Mummy.description: Rarely artificially created, drowned mummies are miserable, dripping undead that have adapted to exist in an aquatic environment, usually over centuries, after their tomb or lair becomes flooded.

DFO5TG9a9XSW1ZCQ.name: Aquatic Echolocation (Precise) 120 feet
DFO5TG9a9XSW1ZCQ.description: A drowned mummy can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range but only underwater.

9kbgRdQ3ETNB56f2.name: Water Pressure
9kbgRdQ3ETNB56f2.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature that begins its turn within the aura feels overburdened by the weight of the water around it and must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:35] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Encumbered} for as long as it remains in the area. A creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to water pressure for 24 hours. Water pressure only functions while the drowned mummy is underwater and can only affect creatures that are in contact with the same body of water.

4vu636kxS4VGzdBb.name: Aquatic Advantage
4vu636kxS4VGzdBb.description: A drowned mummy's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 damage against creatures in the same body of water as the drowned mummy.

VhlqeFWKIF1E1hja.name: Rancid Bloat
VhlqeFWKIF1E1hja.description:
This disease and damage from it can't be healed unless this curse is removed. A creature killed by rancid bloat rots away to waterlogged pieces of flesh and can't be resurrected except by an 8th-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual or similar magic.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:38]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 minute)

Stage 2 [[/r 12d6[negative]]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

Stage 3 [[/r 16d6[negative]]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 4}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4} (1 day)

ODB0ADki8uJ1yfU4.name: Whirlpool
ODB0ADki8uJ1yfU4.description:
Requirements The drowned mummy is underwater

Effect The drowned mummy commands the water to churn, creating a powerful whirlpool centered on itself. Each creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] centered on the drowned mummy takes [[/r 14d8[bludgeoning]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:38|basic:true]) as the powerful current batters them around. A creature that fails this save is pushed 20 feet away from the mummy and also falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} on a critical failure. The drowned mummy can't use Whirlpool again for [[/r 1d4 #Whirlpool Recharge]]{1d4 rounds}.

Creeping Crone.name: Creeping Crone
Creeping Crone.description: Hags are neither immortal nor unageing; if not slain by an enemy, a hag eventually succumbs to old age. A hag who dies in agony or rage can rise again as a witchfire, while those who die of old age might rise again as an undead creature known as a creeping crone. A creeping crone has lost far more than her life; they can't form or join covens, denying them one of a living hag's most distinguishing abilities. This inability, more than their rotting bodies or hunger for flesh, makes creeping crones exiled among their former kin.

IsGLZSTgHv6OcM8A.name: Stick Support
IsGLZSTgHv6OcM8A.description: If a creeping crone is deprived of her walking stick, her Speed is reduced to 5 feet (though she can use some other Speed she gains, such as from her @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.A2JfEKe6BZcTG1S8]{Fly} spell) until she recovers her walking stick or fashions another.

LsouI25tE5V0xDXo.description:
The creeping crone can take on the appearance of any Medium humanoid woman, changing her walking stick to suit her new appearance. This doesn't change her Speed or Strikes, but it might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

VrGfMpbeUpjxlrpG.name: Discipline the Righteous
VrGfMpbeUpjxlrpG.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The creeping crone critically hits a good creature with her walking stick Strike

Effect The target takes [[/r 2d8[bleed]]] damage.

WWbqQZvhR7cFlPYO.name: Walking Stick
WWbqQZvhR7cFlPYO.description: A creeping crone can spend 1 day enchanting her walking stick with the powers of a +2 striking greater staff of necromancy. A crone replaces any material component of an occult spell she casts by using the walking stick as a focus component instead. The walking stick's magic functions only for the crone who created it; for anyone else, it's a mundane stick. If the crone enchants a new walking stick, the previous stick loses all its powers.

Ghostly Mob.name: Ghostly Mob
Ghostly Mob.description: When a horrific tragedy results in mass death, the restless spirits of the numerous dead might arise as a ghostly mob. Like other ghosts, ghostly mobs are often unaware they're dead. The spirits trapped within the mob may try to carry out a semblance of their former lives, even though their memories are fragmentary and their forms are insubstantial. When forced to confront their true state, the spirits lash out in pain and violence.

Tc3W28SMOSvvjreh.name: Site Bound
Tc3W28SMOSvvjreh.description: A ghostly mob can stray only a moderate distance from where its members were killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 240 feet.

VGvxP7aM22lBfMEo.name: Rejuvenation
VGvxP7aM22lBfMEo.description: When a ghostly mob is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #Days]]{2d4 days}, fully healed. A ghostly mob can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the troop from resting.

1hGao82GHZbkFICr.name: Clutching Hands
1hGao82GHZbkFICr.description:
1 to 3

Frequency once per round

Effect The troop attacks enemies within 5 feet (@Check[type:reflex|dc:25|basic:true]), with damage depending on the number of actions.

1 [[/r (1d6+3)[negative]]] damage

2 [[/r (3d6+6)[negative]]] damage

3 [[/r (4d6+9)[negative]]] damage

dgo5bOyuntQs7dwi.name: Frightful Chorus
dgo5bOyuntQs7dwi.description: The ghostly mob howls in anguish, forcing each living creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] to attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). Regardless of the save result, the creature is then temporarily immune to the troop's Frightful Chorus for 1 minute.

fa962sidQFXoub56.name: Troop Movement
fa962sidQFXoub56.description: Whenever the ghostly mob Strides, it first Forms Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), and then moves. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any of the ghostly mob's squares enter difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole group.

Choking Tethers.name: Blood Lords
Choking Tethers.description: Three shadow tethers form when a creature reaches the hall's midpoint; each lashes, grabs, and crushes creatures in the hall.
Choking Tethers.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:48] (legendary) to disable each tether or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (10th level, counteract DC 48) to counteract each tether
Choking Tethers.hazardRoutine: (six actions) This trap loses 2 actions each turn for each disabled shadow tether. Each shadow tether has 2 actions it can use to either Strike a creature or Constrict a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} creature, in any combination.

Precarious Bone Pile.name: Blood Lords
Precarious Bone Pile.description: This ancient pile of bones appears stable, but the slightest disturbance topples them.
Precarious Bone Pile.hazardDisable: @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:20] (trained) or @Check[type:stealth|dc:20] (trained) to shimmy past the bones without disturbing them, or deal any amount of damage to trigger the collapse from a distance

Kepgeda the Hag-Nailed.name: Kepgeda the Hag-Nailed
Kepgeda the Hag-Nailed.npcAllSaves: +1 circumstance bonus to Will saves against mental effects

vzdMOcWihp5bnBFL.name: Keys to Area E13 and the Crooked Coffin Grates

Xhw1CnUN1OjZjqTD.name: Called
Xhw1CnUN1OjZjqTD.description: In constantly resisting her desire to return to her mother, Kepgeda has developed a mental bulwark. If she rolls a success on a saving throw against a mental effect that would make her controlled, she gets a critical success instead.

tI0Nz7ZwoXgwzFnE.name: +1 Circumstance Bonus to Will Saves Against Mental Effects

xGcUmFIwoqQu2UbT.name: Cackling Coven
xGcUmFIwoqQu2UbT.description:
Trigger Kepgeda's turn begins

Requirements Kepgeda is within 30 feet of her keening cauldron

Effect Kepgeda draws on the souls of her dead sisters for a burst of occult power, for a price. Kepgeda takes [[/r 10[mental]]] damage, then chooses one:

  • Kepgeda Sustains a Spell. If her next action is to cast a witch hex, the DC of that hex increases by 1.
  • Kepgeda reduces her @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied} condition value to 0.
  • If Kepgeda begins casting a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.c3b6LdLlQDPngNIb]{Create Undead} ritual within the next minute, she attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:18] when the ritual is complete; on a success, the undead she's created is 3 levels higher than the ritual would provide (for example, creating a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Ix1PziAEk9IIMYBz]{Zombie Brute} instead of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.0plBflWwrCWQO2RO]{Zombie Shambler}).

cT3KWKRJkHa9bbfD.name: Familiar
cT3KWKRJkHa9bbfD.description: Kepgeda's familiar is Iskessous, a rat with a climb Speed of 25 feet, darkvision, and scent as an imprecise sense to a range of 30 feet.

Pain Milker.name: Blood Lords
Pain Milker.description: An eerie machine made of levers, crystals, and glowing bits of metal that, as one draws near, causes unsettling aches and pains.
Pain Milker.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:33] (master) to deactivate the machine, or @Check[type:perception|dc:38] (expert) to decipher the proper order in which the switches and dials should be adjusted in order to power the device down harmlessly
Pain Milker.hazardReset: If the augnagar still lives and at least one crystallized agony is still functional, the pain milker resets automatically in a number of rounds equal to 7 - the number of remaining crystallized agonies.

Demilich Skull.name: Blood Lords
Demilich Skull.description: The skull of a defeated demilich is haunted by souls of the demilich's victims.
Demilich Skull.hazardDisable: @Check[type:arcana|dc:26], @Check[type:occultism|dc:26], @Check[type:nature|dc:26], or @Check[type:religion|dc:26] to counteract the skull's Broken Gems

Prachalla.name: Prachalla
Prachalla.description:
Soulbound dolls are eerie mannequins or playthings that have been imbued with a small piece of a deceased mortal's soul. These little constructs are created for a variety of reasons-such as to serve as companions or servants-but their free will means their obedience to their creators is hardly a given. Followers of Pharasma generally abhor soulbound dolls, viewing them as a perversion of the natural cycle of souls, and those who worship the Lady of Graves see the destruction of a soulbound doll, regardless of the construct's alignment, as an important service to the Great Beyond. Soulbound dolls are the simplest in a series of soulbound constructs including human-sized soulbound mannequins, powerful soulbound shells, and sentinel soulbound terra-cotta warriors. Creating them from unwilling living creatures is evil, and an unwilling donor can resist the process with a successful Will save against the creator's Craft DC, ruining the doll if not preventing the donor's death. A non-evil doll can only be crafted from the soul of a person who has given consent to such use before their death occurred

Soulbound dolls encountered by adventurers are typically guardians of some sort; despite their diminutive size, the soul fragment's power makes the doll's flst more dangerous than a casual observer would expect. Further, it grants the doll a single spell of outsized power given its stature. Because of their autonomy and remarkable intelligence, soulbound dolls are occasionally employed by their crafters as administrators over much more powerful but mindless constructs such as golems, allowing such dolls to control defenses far beyond their own capabilities. Though soulbound dolls contain a small fragment of a soul extracted during or shortly after a person's death, this doesn't affect the deceased's resurrection or progress to the afterlife. This extraction process is lethal to otherwise-living prospective soul donors, though there are rumors of more expensive processes that allows someone to donate a fragment of a living soul without repercussions.

The soul fragment resides in a soul focus gem typically embedded in the doll's neck or chest. The soul fragment isn't static, and the doll continues to learn from its initial state, meaning its personality and abilities can change, possibly growing closer to the donor's or moving farther afield on its own individual path. The soulbound doll's focus gem retains the doll's memories even after the doll's destruction. The the intact soul focus gem of a destroyed doll can even be placed into a new doll body by someone knowledgeable in the creation of soulbound creatures, effectively reconstituting the soulbound doll.

0qLV4XXhIJyka38A.name: Personality Fragments
0qLV4XXhIJyka38A.description: A soulbound doll shares fragments of the donor's soul personality, though none of that creature's memories. The Prachalla doll is animated by the soul of a spy who worked for an organized crime ring in Kaer Maga; she was working undercover as a maid when she died.

VMY4BFNvsVHx85It.description:
Prachalla deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Padh4azq1HtiVrHg.name: Surprise Attack
Padh4azq1HtiVrHg.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} to Prachalla.

pCnMQdVFDpVoiEMP.name: Phantom Steed
pCnMQdVFDpVoiEMP.description: Summoned by Seldeg's Phantom Steed ability. The steed can walk or fly at a Speed of 80 feet, can walk on water, and ignores natural difficult terrain and can hold its rider's body weight, plus 20 Bulk

Floating Femur.name: Floating Femur
Floating Femur.description:
Floating femurs can deliver a powerful blow. They make handy weapons for those who manage to grab hold of them.

Commonly mistaken for undead, animated bones are mindless constructs with no connection to necromancy. The following are examples of typical animated bones.

tY3TZfRWPDy9qUYl.name: Gotcha!
tY3TZfRWPDy9qUYl.description: A floating femur freezes up if @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. For 1 minute after the femur becomes grabbed or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by a creature, the femur can't act, and the creature holding it can use it as a +1 club with the fatal d10 trait. After that time, the floating femur can act and is generally quite aggressive toward whomever used it as a weapon.

Ghiasi's Double.name: Ghiasi's Double
Ghiasi's Double.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. divination

cI431Dx0ib1ik3yK.name: Shadow Shift
cI431Dx0ib1ik3yK.description: Being made partially of shadow, shae are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} in dim light or darkness even to creatures that can see clearly in those light levels.

rzzDTTRv6sX73Yu2.name: Counterattack
rzzDTTRv6sX73Yu2.description:
Trigger Ghiasi's double is targeted by an attack from an adjacent creature that misses due to her being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}

Requirements Ghiasi's double is aware of the attack

Effect Ghiasi's double makes a Strike against the attacker.

Oaq4T5auxVlppuFQ.name: Multiple Reactions
Oaq4T5auxVlppuFQ.description: Ghiasi's double gains an additional reaction each turn that she can only use to Slip.

lqLxZLzDQ2kV4c78.name: Slip
lqLxZLzDQ2kV4c78.description:
Trigger A creature moves adjacent to Ghiasi's double

Effect Ghiasi's double teleports to a clear space adjacent to another creature she can see within 30 feet.

7bleURu8R5FzBx08.name: Shadow Gate
7bleURu8R5FzBx08.description: Ghiasi opens or closes a gate between Twined Stories and the House of Inspiring Shadows, although the gate must be opened in the same place each time. It remains open until she uses this ability again, but she can't close the gate until at least 10 minutes after she opens it.

5QDAOEZkWIjzDQPo.name: Tenebral Form
5QDAOEZkWIjzDQPo.description: Ghiasi's double can Fly at full Speed in gaseous form.

Harmony In Agony.name: Harmony In Agony
Harmony In Agony.npcHp: coffin restoration, fast healing 10, negative healing

CqqRbppW3YzLhWby.name: Harmony's Harp (Virtuoso)
CqqRbppW3YzLhWby.description:
Harmony's harp is a virtuoso instrument that weights 8 Bulk and is worth 500 gp for its artistic quality.

Handheld instruments include bagpipes, a small set of chimes, small drums, fiddles and viols, flutes and recorders, small harps, lutes, trumpets, and similarly sized instruments. The GM might rule that an especially large handheld instrument (like a tuba) has greater Bulk. Heavy instruments such as large drums, a full set of chimes, and keyboard instruments are less portable and generally need to be stationary while played. A virtuoso instrument gives a +1 item bonus to Performance checks using that instrument.

omRU4fUfaCd6zdAI.name: Distracting Bitterness
omRU4fUfaCd6zdAI.description:
A character can attempt to incite Harmony's bitterness by mentioning how Hyrune treats her like a servant rather than a companion by attempting a @Check[type:deception|dc:32] or @Check[type:intimidation|dc:32] check.

Critical Success Harmony shrieks in anger and abandons the fight at once, screaming "I'll teach him a lesson he won't soon forget!" as she Turns to Mist and leaves to seek out Hyrune.

Success Harmony shrieks in anger, then becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as her fury distracts her on the following round.

Failure The attempt fails, and Harmony is temporarily immune to further attempts to distract her in this way from that character for 24 hours

Critical Failure The attempt backfires, instead enraging Harmony. She is temporarily immune to further attempts to distract her in this way from anyone for 24 hours, and gains a +2 status bonus on Strikes made against the character who failed this check during this time.

NwdUeTnAhtTWQgPj.name: Change Shape
NwdUeTnAhtTWQgPj.description:
• Bat Harmony changes into a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.C9s5tBxVValC2HTE]{Giant Bat}. She gains echolocation 40 feet, a land Speed of 20 feet and a fly Speed of 30 feet, and a fangs Strike ([[/r 1d20+26]]{+26}, [[/r 1d20+21]]{+21}, [[/r 1d20+16]]{+16}) [[/r (3d8+10)[piercing]]].

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

L2kBrzhlIfqVDEC1.name: Dominate
L2kBrzhlIfqVDEC1.description:
The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait. The save DC uses the DC of the vampire's level, and a creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

Shoki.name: Shoki
Shoki.description:
Shokis are shepherds who lead wayward souls to the Boneyard.

Psychopomps preside over death and the cycle of souls.
Shoki.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

oDr6qqRzR4QVrczZ.name: Plane Shift (Self And Locked Soul Only, To The Boneyard Only)

MVJzWbiRIqCaCA3v.name: Infuse Staff
MVJzWbiRIqCaCA3v.description: A shoki's staff becomes a +1 striking staff and is treated as if it were adamantine while the shoki wields it. A shoki's staff has Hardness 14 and HP 56 (BT 28) while possessed by the shoki or Hardness 5 and HP 20 (BT 10) while out of the shoki's possession. A shoki whose staff is taken or destroyed can infuse a new one with an hour of work.

3ZCQLxhf1lgCinva.name: Soul Lock
3ZCQLxhf1lgCinva.description:
Requirements The shoki doesn't have a soul locked within their staff

Effect The shoki attempts to capture the soul of a creature on the brink of death: either an undead creature, a creature with the dying condition, or a creature who died within the last minute. The target must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:32] save with the following results.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune to Soul Lock.

Success The shoki's staff tugs at the creature's soul but doesn't trap it. If the creature is living, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} (or increases its doomed condition by 1). If the creature is a corporeal undead, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}. If the creature is an incorporeal undead, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}. The creature then becomes temporarily immune to Soul Lock for 24 hours.

Failure The shoki captures the creature's soul in its staff. If the creature is living, it dies. If the creature is a corporeal undead, its body becomes an inanimate corpse. While the soul is locked in the staff, the target can't be returned to life or undeath, or rejuvenate through any means, save for powerful magic, such as miracle or wish. If the shoki's staff is destroyed or the shoki wills it, the soul is released. A shoki's staff can only hold one soul at a time.

May8pisi3prNRNuU.name: Spirit Touch
May8pisi3prNRNuU.description: A shoki's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a ghost touch property rune and deal [[/r 2d6[negative]]] damage to living creatures and [[/r 2d6[positive]]] damage to undead.

Eseneth.name: Eseneth
Eseneth.description:
Eseneths, commonly known as soul-stitchers, are dispassionate surgeons who repair damaged souls.

Psychopomps preside over death and the cycle of souls.

xRxPAjswWOJyItbO.name: Sudden Stitch
xRxPAjswWOJyItbO.description:
Trigger A creature within the eseneth's reach successfully Strikes the eseneth

Effect The eseneth attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the triggering creature.

sy6ZKFJRQ0uLMPAR.name: Mend Soul
sy6ZKFJRQ0uLMPAR.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The eseneth restores [[/r 25[healing]]]{25 HP} to itself or an incorporeal creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

ypGQGTvYyK5bAhwW.name: Seize Soul
ypGQGTvYyK5bAhwW.description:
The eseneth tries to yank the soul out of the body of a creature they've @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}. The eseneth attempts an @Check[type:athletics] check against the target's Fortitude DC.

Critical Success The eseneth grabs the target's soul. The body is released and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 2 rounds. When the body ceases being paralyzed, its soul returns instantly and the target wakes. The soulâ€”grabbed by the esenethâ€”is incorporeal, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}, has a fly Speed equal to the creature's Speed, and otherwise has all the same statistics. It can't attack, cast spells, or attempt any skill checks that require a physical body other than checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}, and it must always maintain line of effect to its body.

Success As critical success, but the paralysis ends after 1 round.

Failure The target remains grabbed or restrained, but its soul remains in its body.

Critical Failure The grab ends.

WVJdmD2UxJ7zu1NV.name: Shred Soul
WVJdmD2UxJ7zu1NV.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The eseneth deals [[/r (3d10+14)[force]]] damage to an incorporeal creature they've @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

EbbGmXFaRCF4eAbE.name: Spirit Grasp
EbbGmXFaRCF4eAbE.description: An eseneth can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} incorporeal creatures despite being corporeal. The eseneth uses their Athletics check to Grapple incorporeal creatures as normal but can't use Athletics for other actions against incorporeal creatures, like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip}.

Q9W0tmmKogEnfOJg.name: Spirit Touch
Q9W0tmmKogEnfOJg.description: A eseneth's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a ghost touch property rune and deal [[/r 2d6[negative]]] damage to living creatures and [[/r 2d6[positive]]] damage to undead.

Nydazuul.name: Nydazuul
Nydazuul.description: The brutish and gluttonous augnagar live to feast- preferably on rotten flesh, and when possible, demon flesh. But to them, the greatest delicacy is the flesh of other augnagars. Augnagars have spiderlike legs with leathery membranes like a bat's wings, and three tails ending in hooked claws perfect for slicing flesh.
Nydazuul.npcSenses: greater darkvision, scent (imprecise) 30 feet, true seeing

Hd5SG091X71rJV1D.name: Confusing Display
Hd5SG091X71rJV1D.description:
The augnagar's writhing limbs and flesh seethe and squirm in a disorienting and unsettling manner. Creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:30] save, after which they are temporarily immune to further Confusing Displays for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature can't attempt a flat check to recover from confusion whenever it takes damage from an attack or spell.

kuW4IJohw5LunECQ.name: Inhale Vitality
kuW4IJohw5LunECQ.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The augnagar inhales sharply, drawing life force out of creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50]. Creatures in the area take [[/r 11d6[negative]]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:30|basic:true] save, and the creature is fatigued on a failure). The augnagar becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round on its next turn, and it can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike.

UatC9BxVJopPgwJd.name: Rotting Curse
UatC9BxVJopPgwJd.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the creature displays hideous, festering wounds exuding a horrific stench. Any creature within 30 feet of the victim must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} on a critical failure, for as long as it's sickened).

While within the aura, affected creatures take a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute. The victim of the disease doesn't roll a save, but takes the failure effects automatically and can't reduce its sickened value below 1 (1 day).

Cleansing Fire.name: Blood Lords
Cleansing Fire.description: Sheets of fire and positive energy blast through the room in waves that obliterate the undead and scorch the living.
Cleansing Fire.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:41] (master) to bleed away the trap's energy, or @Check[type:religion|dc:39] (expert) to recite the appropriate prayers to Urgathoa to stop the trap (Pesabnet knows these prayers and automatically succeeds at checks to recite them). Disabling the trap requires three successful checks, in any combination of Thievery and Religion checks.
Cleansing Fire.hazardReset: The sacred fire disappears 1 minute after no creatures are in the room, and the trap immediately resets
Cleansing Fire.hazardRoutine:
(1 action) A wall of sacred fire washes back and forth throughout the room, bathing every inch of the space in holy power and dealing [[/r {3d12[fire],3d12[positive]}]]{3d12 fire damage 3d12 positive damage}. Each creature in the trap's area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:39] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes double damage.

Critical Failure If the creature has negative healing, it is instantly destroyed. Otherwise, it takes double damage and [[/r 1d12[persistent,fire]]] damage.

Button Mash.name: Blood Lords
Button Mash.description: The room floods with harmful effects by pressing a magic sigil on a console. Each sigil causes different results. There are six sigils on the console.
Button Mash.hazardDisable: @Check[type:arcana|dc:40] (master) to disenchant each sigil (can be done from either side of the reception desk), @Check[type:thievery|dc:43] (master) twice to disable the console (can only be done while behind the reception desk), or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 40) to counteract each sigil; prevent Noph from pressing the buttons by gaining access to the reception desk or other methods
Button Mash.hazardRoutine:
(2 actions) Noph frantically pecks and stomps on the console, using each action to press a random sigil. Roll [[/r 1d6 #Pressed Sigil]] to determine which sigil Noph presses. Psychopomps are immune to the effects of these sigils.

1 The area is flooded with holy light, dealing [[/r (3d12+19)[positive]]] damage to each creature in the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:43|basic:true]).

2 The area is flooded with unholy darkness, dealing [[/r (3d12+19)[negative]]] damage to each creature in the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:43|basic:true]).

3 The area is flooded with blue flames, dealing [[/r (3d10+19)[fire]]] damage to each creature in the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:43|basic:true]). On a critical failure, a creature additionally takes [[/r 1d10[persistent,fire]]] damage.

4 A comet streaks through the area, attacking the nearest creature to Noph with a comet Strike.

5 Force tethers sprout from the floor, grasping at intruders. Each creature in the area is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round unless they succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:43] save.

6 Ghostly blue mist surrounds each psychopomp in the area, healing them [[/r (3d8+19)[healing]]]{3d8+19} HP and granting them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealement} for 1 round.

Ancient Skaveling.name: Ancient Skaveling
Ancient Skaveling.description:
Hideous necromantic rituals give rise to skavelings, or ghoul bats, monstrosities that are not true ghouls but instead are specifically crafted undead creatures. Their creators are the bloodsucking urdefhans of the Darklands, who create skavelings from giant bats specially raised on diets of toxic fungus and the flesh of ghouls-especially brains harvested from these undead. Upon reaching maturity, these giant bats are ritually slain via the use of cytillesh oil. While this poison simply rots away the flesh of most creatures, one of these specially prepared bats will immediately rise from death as a skaveling after succumbing to its effects.

Despite its tattered wings and sagging skin, a skaveling is more than capable of flight, even when carrying a creature mounted on its back-urdefhans often use skavelings as mounts in this way. Their intelligence is more advanced than that of the typical giant bat, and in combat they function more as allies than as mere mounts, capable of making their own tactical decisions. Yet even though they can reason and think, skavelings remain loyal to the urdefhans who created them, and they never take actions in a fight that would knowingly put their masters in harm's way.

h35hRTaiSXOfVZFA.name: Echolocation 60 feet
h35hRTaiSXOfVZFA.description: The ancient skaveling can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range

x183YuDiYXsrOlKc.name: Bone-Shattering Screech
x183YuDiYXsrOlKc.description:
The skaveling unleashes a devastating screech that not only chills the bones but shatters them. The screech can be heard throughout the region and alerts all creatures in the Hanging Castle. Creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] take [[/r 12d6[sonic]]] damage must also attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:36] save.

The skaveling can't use Bone-Shattering Screech again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Bone-Shattering Screech for 24 hours.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3}.

aOFgYZJ7qXDOoWDH.name: Ghoul Fever
aOFgYZJ7qXDOoWDH.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r 2d6[negative]]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r 2d6[negative]]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a ghoul the next midnight

2doPyPIBLoDzjzk9.name: Paralysis
2doPyPIBLoDzjzk9.description:
Any creature hit by the skaveling's Strikes must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each save.

Facetbound Nullifier.name: Facetbound Nullifier
Facetbound Nullifier.description:
Designed to serve as devastatingly powerful foot soldiers against enemies with plentiful magic, facetbound nullifiers shear through magical effects as easily as they slice through flesh and bone. The pale lavender ellipsoid aeon stones they bear are sunk deep into their heads and surrounded by an ugly bruise.

Inspired by the work of the Azlanti and their obsessions with aeon stones, certain necromancers strive to tap into those curious magical items to create undead with powerful abilities. A facetbound is created from a living being with an aeon stone surgically attached to their skull who is killed in a specific, secret ritual. Each facetbound must bear a single aeon stone, and this stone determines the powers the facetbound wields (in place of the normal powers of the implanted stone)
Facetbound Nullifier.npcAllSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

Ft46tzCQcolhliMe.name: Implanted Stone
Ft46tzCQcolhliMe.description: A nullifier's aeon stone can't be Disarmed or removed until the nullifier is destroyed.

w9ebZfueLzHUnfqK.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

xd3KrbrDOX8LkahX.name: Always Ready
xd3KrbrDOX8LkahX.description: The nullifier gains an additional reaction each round that can be used only for Defensive Dispel.

wbd0G04A6nbUyWv2.description:
@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

The nullifier can also make attacks of opportunity against concentrate actions to Cast a Spell, and it disrupts that action on any hit, not just a critical hit.

4SNLNMTzQxzhH1op.name: Defensive Dispel
4SNLNMTzQxzhH1op.description:
Trigger The nullifier is the target of a spell

Effect The nullifier attempts to counteract the triggering spell, with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+27 $Counteract]]{+27}. This can be used only on spells that target the nullifier, not area spells that don't have targets. If it succeeds, it counteracts the spell for all targets, if other creatures were targeted in addition to the nullifier.

r5dYGunbr3uNPEDD.name: Field of Force
r5dYGunbr3uNPEDD.description: A nullifier's melee Strikes deal an additional 2d10 force damage (already included in the Strikes above).

s9asrDvWzf12qCDG.name: Sever Spell
s9asrDvWzf12qCDG.description:
Frequency once per round
