Effect Yulthruk inhales some of the averted energy and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} until the start of his next turn. He can use this extra action to Cast a Spell or Sustain a Spell

xy2azhCTZ0mmZqoS.name: Stench
xy2azhCTZ0mmZqoS.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened on a critical failure).

While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.wX9L6fbqVMLP05hn]{Effect: Stench}

vPOhEUDV01FYntbI.name: Consume Flesh
vPOhEUDV01FYntbI.description:
Requirements The ghast is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghast devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r 6d6[healing]]]{6d6 Hit Points}.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

ENqbfe06FpxgYdZv.name: Drain Wand
ENqbfe06FpxgYdZv.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements Yulthruk hasn't acted yet on his turn

Effect On his turn Yulthruk can Cast a Spell he's prepared and already cast this day without spending a spell slot. Yulthruk must still meet the spell's other requirements.

UP609WltTX4fCkkj.name: Ghast Fever
UP609WltTX4fCkkj.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r 3d8[negative]]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r 3d8[negative]]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.VC7rtYR4hLxwg7WZ]{Ghast} the next midnight

ZLcO9eT7RdF6M8kF.name: Paralysis
ZLcO9eT7RdF6M8kF.description: Any living creature hit by a ghast's attack must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

C8Q6XMuXU7BL34xL.name: Swift Leap
C8Q6XMuXU7BL34xL.description: Yulthruk jumps up to half his Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Slamming Gate.name: Blood Lords
Slamming Gate.description: The heavy gate slams shut when opened more than halfway
Slamming Gate.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:15|traits:action:disable-a-device|name:Loosen the Gate Springs] (trained) to loosen the gate's springs before it slams closed
Slamming Gate.hazardReset: The trap can be reactivated (or deactivated, if it's active) by flipping a lever hidden in the nearby wall. A character Searching the area finds it with a successful @Check[type:perception|dc:18|traits:action:seek] check.

Ostovite Nest.name: Blood Lords
Ostovite Nest.description: A nest of bones resembling an ant hill contains countless miniscule scavenger vermin with vicious, acid-dripping mandibles.
Ostovite Nest.hazardDisable: @Check[type:athletics|dc:18|name:Topple the Mound] (trained) to topple the mound and destroy it
Ostovite Nest.hazardReset: The hazard deactivates if there are no targets for its acid spew at the start of its turn. The hatchlings return to the nest, and the hazard resets. If damaged but not destroyed, the nest recovers [[/r 1d6[healing]]]{1d6 Hit Points} per hour as the hatchlings repair it.
Ostovite Nest.hazardRoutine: (1 action) The hazard makes an acid spew Strike against the nearest creature.

Virulak Necromancer.name: Virulak Necromancer
Virulak Necromancer.description:
Virulak necromancers are often intrigued by the interplay between poison and undeath, testing toxins on their dead flesh or, more commonly, on hapless living victims. This virulak necromancer was once a sorcerer but now considers their bloodline irrelevant.

When a creature dies from poison, it sometimes rises as a virulak: an undead being infused with lethal venom. Most virulaks are solitary creatures with memories of an excruciating death. Occasionally, a mass poisoning produces numerous simultaneous fatalities, increasing the chance of many virulaks arising at once and working together in a dangerous mob. Entire villages might rise as virulaks when forced to subsist on food so spoiled it has become toxic or from an intentional scheme to poison the settlement.

Virulaks retain the intelligence and memory they had in life, but their agonizing death by poison transforms them into bitter mockeries of their former selves. Poison seeps from their fingertips and solidifies into hard claws. Virulaks are known for a cynical and ironic sense of humor. They delight in poisoning the good spirits and reputations of those around them, dealing psychological blows that mirror the venom in their bodies.

1vSfiqei9YJPJGSP.name: Uncanny Necromancy
1vSfiqei9YJPJGSP.description: The virulak necromancer can freely heighten @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.8ViwItUgwT4lOvvb]{False Life}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.k34hDOfIIMAxNL4a]{Grim Tendrils}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.N1Z1oLPdBxaSgrEE]{Vampiric Touch} to any level they can cast without knowing them at higher levels.

eM6PixErExqpIpFl.name: Undead Virulence
eM6PixErExqpIpFl.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 2d8[poison]]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r 3d8[poison]]] damage (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r 4d8[poison]]] damage (1 round)

YvUhNZ1GT4PmqTz5.name: Venomous Gaze
YvUhNZ1GT4PmqTz5.description: The virulak locks its gaze on a single creature within 30 feet. The target is exposed to the virulak's undead virulence.

Caustic Shower.name: Blood Lords
Caustic Shower.description: Contact with the doors, pillars, or statue causes a shower of acid.
Caustic Shower.hazardDisable: @Check[type:crafting|dc:48] (master) to ground the charged features or @Check[type:thievery|dc:50] (legendary) to disable the contact sensors

Bulette.name: Bulette
Bulette.description:
Bulettes are fearsome predators that roam just beneath the surface of desolate wilderness areas. When they burrow through the ground, only the fin of their thickly armored backs protrudes above-at least until they are ready to leap out and strike their prey. Their appearance, appetite, and iconic dorsal fin have earned the nickname "landshark."

A typical bulette claims a territory of approximately 500 square miles. When it finds an area rich in food, such as a farming village, it adds that area to its regular patrol route. Over the course of a few months, it can wipe entire settlements off the map. Bulettes are fiercely competitive creatures that battle relentlessly with other predators in their territory. They actively avoid contact or conflict with other members of their kind unless seeking a mate. Bulette pairs share territory and mate for life-a mated pair of bulettes being the only known exception to the creature's penchant for solitude. They rear their young for a short period of time. The mated pair instruct the young bulette how to hunt, teaching their spawn which creatures are easiest to kill and which creatures to avoid. The mated pair drive off their young after its first successful hunt.

The first bulettes were magically created guardians, intended to serve as frightening pets for a power-hungry and sadistic wizard. The technique for their creation, as well as their original purpose, has since been lost to history, and multiple conflicting accounts of ancient texts exist with dozens of wizards claiming to have been the first inventor of the notorious beast. Some sages postulate that the original inventor may have been an elf-a theory born out of little more than the curious fact that bulettes, for all their ravenous nature, seem to find elf flesh unpalatable. Unfortunately for elves who stumble into a bulette's path, bulettes are no less likely to kill them than any other intruder, simply leaving the bodies unconsumed where they fall.

6HaF8caXkGjKoXgx.name: Corpse Eater
6HaF8caXkGjKoXgx.description: These bulettes prefer the taste of necrotic flesh and bone; their favorite prey is undead.

9OItti667EywItzF.name: Favored Prey
9OItti667EywItzF.description: A bulette gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attack and damage rolls with its jaws against a specific type of creature designated as its favorite food. Unless otherwise stated, a bulette's favored prey is halflings. Elves are never a favored prey for bulettes.

woCB9gbBdvxg3WX0.name: Leaping Charge
woCB9gbBdvxg3WX0.description: The bulette attempts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}. If it's adjacent to an enemy at the apex of its High Jump or at the end of its Long Jump, it can make a claw Strike against the enemy at that moment. If the bulette jumps at least 5 feet vertically or at least 20 feet horizontally, it can attempt two claw Strikes instead of one. The bulette's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until it has made all the claw Strikes that are part of its Leaping Charge.

aat9fAhVKzDZsfyl.name: Powerful Jumper
aat9fAhVKzDZsfyl.description: A bulette jumps 10 feet up on a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump}, or 20 feet up on a critical success.

Benefactor's End.name: Blood Lords
Benefactor's End.description: A spectral assailant drives a stake into a dying vampire's heart; the vampire collapses and releases a surge of negative energy.
Benefactor's End.hazardDisable: @Check[type:religion|dc:28] (expert) to drain away the haunt's negative energy
Benefactor's End.hazardReset: Unless disabled, the haunt materializes again on the next moonrise.

Keystone Repulsion.name: Blood Lords
Keystone Repulsion.description: Four magic keystones repel creatures when one is damaged or tampered with.
Keystone Repulsion.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:48] (legendary) to remove each keystone or @Check[type:occultism|dc:48] (legendary) to manipulate the magic to isolate each keystone
Keystone Repulsion.hazardRoutine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each removed or isolated keystone. Each keystone spends 1 action to release a wave of force, dealing [[/r (4d10+22)[force]]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:42|basic:true]) and pushing each creature back 5 feet. On a failed save, the distance a creature is pushed increases to 10 feet.

Terra-cotta Soldier.name: Terra-cotta Soldier
Terra-cotta Soldier.description:
Terra-cotta warriors guard the tombs of ancient rulers, where they stand vigil, animating only when intruders break in to pilfer riches or defile the tomb itself. Each warrior is meticulously crafted from clay and given unique features.

A single terra-cotta warrior stands 6 feet tall and weighs 600 pounds.

Shadow Lash.name: Blood Lords
Shadow Lash.description: Four pillars manifest shadow lashes that attack intruders.
Shadow Lash.hazardDisable: @Check[type:arcana|dc:46] (legendary) to drain the magic from each shadow lash or @Check[type:thievery|dc:48] (legendary) to disable each shadow lash
Shadow Lash.hazardRoutine: (8 actions) This trap loses 2 actions each turn for each disabled shadow lash. Each shadow lash has 2 actions it can use to perform the following actions.

Urgathoa's Ire.name: Blood Lords
Urgathoa's Ire.description: A statue of Urgathoa fires eye beams at intruders.
Urgathoa's Ire.hazardDisable: @Check[type:religion|dc:48] (legendary) to disenchant each eye through prayer or @Check[type:thievery|dc:48] (legendary) to disable each eye
Urgathoa's Ire.hazardRoutine: (1 action) The trap shoots a concentrated beam of fire at a random intruder. The trap makes an eye beam Strike. If one of Urgathoa's eyes has been disabled, this Strike deals half damage.

Sahni Bride-Of-The-Sea.name: Sahni Bride-Of-The-Sea
Sahni Bride-Of-The-Sea.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

tMZFtFOnhFklTFgg.name: Coven
tMZFtFOnhFklTFgg.description: Sahni adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.f8hRqLJaxBVhF1u0]{Acid Arrow}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.z2mfh3oPnfYqXflY]{Mariner's Curse}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Seaah9amXg70RKw2]{Water Walk} to her coven's spells.

4JQCEMoeJlcDamCi.name: Bride's Bargain
4JQCEMoeJlcDamCi.description: Sahni can make a bargain with a willing creature of sound mind. The creature gives away a special quality-such as its courage, beauty, or voice-or sacrifices a loved one in exchange for a boon or a promise from Sahni. As long as Sahni keeps her end of the bargain, the only way to restore a lost quality is to defeat Sahni or make another bargain for its return. Loved ones sacrificed for Sahni's bargain can't be restored except with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle}, or similarly powerful magic.

s1W6qbbXuGOf5KH9.name: Curse of Futility
s1W6qbbXuGOf5KH9.description:
Sahni gazes upon a creature, affecting it with an overwhelming sense that every action it takes is futile; that humiliating failure is their only possible future. The target attempts a @Check[type:will|dc:25] save; the target doesn't need to be able to see Sahni.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and temporarily immune to Sahni's Curse of Futility for 24 hours.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round and then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The target is stupefied 2 for 1 hour and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} as long as it is stupefied.

sbJrYK7O0j91qRUJ.name: Scattered Coven
sbJrYK7O0j91qRUJ.description: As a scattered coven, the Graveclaw grants Sahni the ability to cast the following spells as 3rd-level occult spells, once per day each, without requiring help from her fellow coven members: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.f8hRqLJaxBVhF1u0]{Acid Arrow}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.B3eLlbaPxOYHcs1o]{Curse Of Lost Time}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.xlRv8vCTHh1NeMpw]{Mimic Undead}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Seaah9amXg70RKw2]{Water Walk}. If Sahni is the third hag they confront, the coven is broken and she lacks these coven spells.

Wrathful Dinosaur.name: Blood Lords
Wrathful Dinosaur.description: This figurine of a charging triceratops was crafted from the dinosaur's femur and contains its spirit.
Wrathful Dinosaur.hazardDisable: @Check[type:nature|dc:24] (expert) to banish the dinosaur's spirit with a primal incantation, @Check[type:intimidation|dc:28] to scare it off with a frightening display, or @Check[type:survival|dc:26] (expert) to calm the spirit

NJ7cTeN4x2t0WHaF.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 8)
NJ7cTeN4x2t0WHaF.description: Like normal objects, an animated tea cart has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the tea cart takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated tea cart is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 24.

wLRyKa64zoa1vKn9.name: Scald
wLRyKa64zoa1vKn9.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The tea cart ejects piping-hot tea in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals [[/r 5d6[fire]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true]).

Cobblebone Swarm.name: Cobblebone Swarm
Cobblebone Swarm.description:
Graydirge's necromancer-architects used a horrifying rending process to strip the flesh and souls off most bones involved in Graydirge's construction, but modern builders lack the benefit of such gruesomely efficient magic. When haunted bones are embedded in buildings alongside mundane materials, nearby bricks and cobblestones can be infused with necromantic energy. If no one exorcises the spirits haunting the bones, they become trapped and confused, their identities and memories intermingling. After several years, they can form cobblebone swarms, malevolent haunted amalgamations of brick and bone. These vengeful creatures conjure ghostly noises to lure victims down narrow alleys or into dark stone basements, where they pummel them to death and cover their remains beneath piles of bones and brick.

Some have mistaken cobblebone swarms for cobbleswarms, but citizens of Graydirge know to look for nearby apparitions, or studded bones that move when you look away. These are sure signs of a cobblebone swarm, and an indication that one should take a different route to their destination.

Cobblebone swarms look like piles of simple bricks or cobblestones with crooked bones embedded in them, often in the shape of crude faces. As they roll along or float slowly through the air, they leave a ghostly afterimage in their wake.

zGBrolmCtqnMeB9V.name: Hatred for Secret Doors
zGBrolmCtqnMeB9V.description: Cobblebone swarms have a hatred for secret doors, trick drawers, or anything else that conceals hidden spaces, as such things remind them of years or decades spent trapped within stone. They gain a +5 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Force Open} secret doors.

mEncHvkwzXvMWRkR.name: Jutting Bones
mEncHvkwzXvMWRkR.description: The cobblebone swarm's space is difficult terrain.

snTIGb2g7DF1L8wx.name: Phantasmal Pummeling
snTIGb2g7DF1L8wx.description: Each foe in the cobblebone swarm's space takes [[/r {1d6[bludgeoning],1d6[negative]}]]{1d6 bludgeoning damage and 1d6 negative damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true]).

LpV8movSEB2EyosK.name: Settlement Bound
LpV8movSEB2EyosK.description: A typical cobblebone swarm must remain in the settlement where it originated and can travel no farther than 1 mile from it without falling apart into component pieces, reviving if its pieces are returned to this area. Occasionally, cobblebone swarms are bound to a specific building, road, or district, rather than a settlement.

Nightmare Portal.name: Blood Lords
Nightmare Portal.description: Horrific visions of a lumbering monstrosity whose face is nothing but a fanged mouth lurch out of the violet mist to attempt to eat the viewer alive.
Nightmare Portal.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:42|name:Focus the Portal's Energy|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to focus the portal's energies back in on itself to close it off, or @Check[type:occultism|dc:36|name:Invoke the Proper Chant] (master) to invoke the proper chant and make the proper hand gestures to untether the portal from the Dreamlands, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 34) to counteract the portal for 1 minute and prevent Orgesh's influence from reaching through during that time
Nightmare Portal.hazardReset: The nightmare portal resets 1 minute after it no longer detects targets.
Nightmare Portal.hazardRoutine: (2 actions) A vision of an immense lumbering figure with nothing but a circular mouth for a face lurches out of the portal. For each action, the nightmare portal casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.tlcrVRqW1MSKJ5IC]{Phantasmal Killer} (heightened to 8th level, @Check[type:will|dc:38|traits:death,emotion,fear,mental]), targeting a different creature both times. It can select targets in area E11, the secret alcove to the northeast, or up to 10 feet east from the door (although a closed door blocks it), choosing the closest two targets each round. The nightmare portal loses 1 action if it's broken and can thus only cast phantasmal killer once per round.

bWaig98GPFOqqgGh.name: Lancer
bWaig98GPFOqqgGh.description: The skeletal knight uses a lance in one hand, even when it isn't mounted. If the skeletal knight critically hits a creature with its lance Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the start of the skeletal knight's next turn.

The Putrid Rise.name: Blood Lords
The Putrid Rise.description: The stink of bile suddenly grows as the myriad mouths carved into the walls begin to vomit forth a deluge of acidic slurry.
The Putrid Rise.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:33] (master) to disrupt the trap's magical network of sensors and effectively "blind" it to targets to react to, @Check[type:religion|dc:38] (master) to recognize the carvings and recall one of the mantras needed to pass safely, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th level; counteract DC 32) to counteract the trap.
The Putrid Rise.hazardReset: The trap deactivates 1 round after no targets can be sensed, but resets immediately.
The Putrid Rise.hazardRoutine: On its turn, the trap Vomits as its action. As long as the Putrid Rise is active, the stairs in area D3 are difficult terrain.

Collapsing Bridge.name: Blood Lords
Collapsing Bridge.description: An iron bridge's connectors give way to drop into the lake below.
Collapsing Bridge.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:40|name:Disable Quick Release Mechanism|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disable one side of the bridge's quick release mechanisms

Psychic Wave.name: Blood Lords
Psychic Wave.description: A wave of psychic energy ripples through the room, violently prying into the minds of creatures in the area and alerting Kemnebi to the presence of intruders.
Psychic Wave.hazardDisable: @Check[type:arcana|dc:50] (legendary) to stymie the psychic energy before it manifests

Unstable Fiendflame Cage.name: Blood Lords
Unstable Fiendflame Cage.description: The Fiendflame Cage is uncontrolled, releasing holy light and hellfire in the area.
Unstable Fiendflame Cage.hazardDisable: @Check[type:arcana|dc:48], @Check[type:nature|dc:48], @Check[type:occultism|dc:48], or @Check[type:religion|dc:48] (master) four times on the Fiendflame Cage to calm it through ritual incantations
Unstable Fiendflame Cage.hazardRoutine: (2 actions) On its initiative, the Fiendflame Cage uses 1 action to release a wave of hellfire, dealing [[/r {(2d10+12)[evil],(2d10+12)[fire]}]]{2d10+12 evil damage and 2d10+12 fire damage} to all creatures in a @Template[type:burst|distance:15]{15-foot-radius burst} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:47|basic:true]). The Fiendflame Cage uses its second action to release a wave of holy light, dealing [[/r {(2d10+12)[good],(2d10+12)[fire]}]]{2d10+12 good damage and 2d10+12 fire damage} to all creatures in a @Template[type:burst|distance:15]{15-foot-radius burst} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:47|basic:true]).

Glyph of Warding (B8).name: Blood Lords
Glyph of Warding (B8).description: A magical glyph flashes before triggering a spell.
Glyph of Warding (B8).hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:33] (trained) to disable the glyph, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th level, counteract DC 33) to counteract the glyph

Drusilla.name: Drusilla
Drusilla.description:
At first glance, a huldra seems a simple creature-a human in plain robes or peasant dress, sporting long, unbound hair. These tresses and full skirts in fact disguise the huldra's supernatural features: a hollow wooden back, a long bovine tail, and incredible strength.

Folk legends from the lands of the north describe huldras as the creations of troll witches, intended to lure potential meals to the slaughter. Indeed, a huldra's regeneration is so similar to a troll's that a link between the two creatures seems entirely possible, but huldras despise trolls and resent tales suggesting any connection between them. Rather, huldras are wardens of the woodlands they occupy. Grown from saplings by powerful forest-dwelling fey as a response to humanoid encroachment, huldras protect and parley for the forest itself. Woodland creatures adore huldras, and sometimes approach humans or elves thinking they're huldras. This illusion is shattered if the animal sees the humanoid's back is made of flesh or that they're lacking a tail, at which point the animal recoils and runs away.

Huldras respond well to travelers who show respect and deference for the forest, bestowing those they favor with supernatural luck and fortune. Those who scorn or attack a huldra, or those who mock their distinctive, bovine tails, find themselves plagued by poor decisions and even worse luck. Huldras commonly carry a bad reputation as sirens of the deep forest-cunning monsters who seek to lure woodcutters and unwary adventurers to uncertain ends. These stories largely come from miscreants foolish enough to have treated a huldra rudely and later complain about how they were unjustly persecuted. Even woodcutters and hunters can stay in the good graces of huldras provided they plant few trees to replace what they've taken and don't kill any creatures they don't eat.

Though huldras choose to appear unassuming, the attention they put into disguising the supernatural parts of their bodies is sometimes lacking when it comes to their strength. They often perform feats of strength, like bending horseshoes straight or lifting heavy objects, without realizing they're breaking their carefully crafted facade.

ux8vrBZVt7jnRi5F.name: Axan Walk
ux8vrBZVt7jnRi5F.description: Drusilla ignores non-magical difficult and greater difficult terrain within Axan Wood.

BEcAt0SdsvIa6qp9.name: Befuddling Lash
BEcAt0SdsvIa6qp9.description: When Drusilla damages a creature with her tail, a wave of befuddlement clouds the target's thoughts. The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:23] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute.

vkQCMGp1H43fc8Jo.name: Manipulate Luck
vkQCMGp1H43fc8Jo.description:
Drusilla touches another creature to manipulate the creature's luck. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:25] save. On a failure, Drusilla chooses good luck or bad luck. If she chooses good luck, the affected creature can roll twice on one d20 roll within the next day and use the higher result; this is a fortune effect. If Drusilla chooses bad luck, the creature must roll twice and use the lower result on its next d20 roll; this is a misfortune effect. Once Drusilla has affected a target with Manipulate Luck, that target is temporarily immune to Manipulate Luck from any huldra for 1 day.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.campaign-effects.NwF6m7SyaqwjdQxT]{Effect: Manipulate Luck - Drusilla (Good)}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.zzdOof9hHUf9s13H]{Effect: Manipulate Luck (Bad)}

ae3SxCMfvZIgesia.name: Give Them the Slip
ae3SxCMfvZIgesia.description:
Trigger Dead Faine gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} condition

Effect Dead Faine slips out of his disguise to escape; he removes the grabbed, immobilized, and restrained conditions imposed by the triggering event, then he Steps. If Dead Faine is currently Impersonating, his disguise is ruined, and he's exposed as himself.

WGMIZhZMyM5r1alA.name: Adopt Persona
WGMIZhZMyM5r1alA.description: Dead Faine attempts a Deception check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate}. He doesn't take a penalty to this check due to lacking a disguise kit, to appear as an undead, or to appear as a specific individual.

eO2CyGHELcoHIq2K.name: Feinting Strike
eO2CyGHELcoHIq2K.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements Dead Faine is within melee reach of an enemy

Effect Dead Faine Feints, then Strikes the target of his @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint}.

KilTEDOADZehIMO5.description:
Dead Faine deals an additional 4d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures. This increases to 6d6 against creatures flat-footed due to Dead Faine's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} or Traitorous Betrayal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

OMtaIqvZMW0FPGA3.name: Traitorous Betrayal
OMtaIqvZMW0FPGA3.description: Dead Faine Interacts to draw his dagger and Strikes with it. If the target believes Dead Faine was anyone other than himself, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against Dead Faine's attack.

Phalanx of Phalanges.name: Phalanx of Phalanges
Phalanx of Phalanges.description:
Made up of hundreds of finger and toe bones, a phalanx of phalanges clatters along the ground in an eerily uniform manner.

Commonly mistaken for undead, animated bones are mindless constructs with no connection to necromancy. The following are examples of typical animated bones.

dvfKEC0Lh8HTPG5D.name: Predetermined Path
dvfKEC0Lh8HTPG5D.description: A phalanx of phalanges knows a single path on even ground no longer than 100 feet, as determined by its creator. The phalanx of phalanges makes no actions other than moving along this path or making Countless Digits attacks against creatures in its way. If impeded on this path or if it takes damage, the phalanx of phalanges is unbound from its path and is permanently berserk, attacking nearby creatures to the best of its ability.

FZwSFqaynmTAfiNW.name: Countless Digits
FZwSFqaynmTAfiNW.description: Each other creature in the phalanx of phalanges' space takes [[/r 1d6[piercing]]] damage ([[/r (1d6+2)[piercing]]] damage if the swarm is berserk) (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true]). On a critical failure, the target is thoroughly pinned by the phalanges, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 17) or until any creature uses 2 Interact actions to scrape away the bones pinning them down.

twj4EKcScsSt0E5V.name: Teach You a Lesson
twj4EKcScsSt0E5V.description:
1 to 3

Frequency once per round

Effect The members of the mob wildly swing their textbooks and suppliesâ€”primarily spellbooks and stavesâ€”in a chaotic attack at each enemy adjacent to the troop (@Check[type:reflex|dc:41|basic:true]). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 [[/r (2d12+14)[bludgeoning]]] damage

2 [[/r (3d12+14)[bludgeoning]]] damage

3 [[/r (4d12+14)[bludgeoning]]] damage

DbJuTvhgPXEqgKCk.name: Troop Movement
DbJuTvhgPXEqgKCk.description: Whenever the troop Strides, they first Form Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then moves up to their Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the troop enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole troop.

rtzKA1GRO6XUXbNO.name: Troop Spellcasting
rtzKA1GRO6XUXbNO.description: When the necromancer troop Casts a Spell, their constituent members combine their efforts into casting a more powerful version of the spell than any one member could achieve alone. When Casting a Spell that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and doesn't have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius isn't affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that's normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

T0tQ5d8VBPe1CC9S.name: Slow
T0tQ5d8VBPe1CC9S.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

6GKslxzXKEVmhTWd.name: Trundling Gore
6GKslxzXKEVmhTWd.description: Mosghuta surges forward at her foe, horn lowered. She Strides once. If she ends her movement within melee range of an enemy, she makes a horn Strike against that enemy. If that Strike succeeds, Mosghuta uses Knockdown as a free action.

wzSJWae75A7zglgb.description:
Sewn from several long strips of luxurious brown and black silk, this cloak grants you a +2 item bonus to Stealth checks as well as to Acrobatics checks to Maneuver in Flight. You can also use your feet to hang from any surface that can support your weight, without requiring any check, though you still must attempt Athletics checks to Climb in order to move around while inverted.

Activate D command, Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect You can either transform the cloak into bat-like wings that grant you a fly Speed of 30 feet for 10 minutes, or have the cloak turn you into a bat by casting a 4th-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.gfPjmG6Fe6D3MFjl]{Pest Form} spell on you.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.ioGzmVSmMGXWWBYb]{Effect: Cloak of the Bat}

pJt9Jjt17jRLK4oP.name: Consume Flesh
pJt9Jjt17jRLK4oP.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r 7d6[healing]]]{7d6 Hit Points}. It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

She also absorbs a portion of the memories once possessed by the creature she fed upon, potentially revealing secrets held by the flesh at the GM's discretion, and also gains a +1 status bonus to all skill checks for 1 minute.

noZrrPatG0HlCOmr.name: Ghoul Fever
noZrrPatG0HlCOmr.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r 2d6[negative]]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r 2d6[negative]]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

wWlq8cB7VIQ0GuXZ.name: Paralysis
wWlq8cB7VIQ0GuXZ.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

5GXnNfNwoPtx9p4a.name: Recall Memory
5GXnNfNwoPtx9p4a.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Yurgak focuses her thoughts and recalls a memory from a previously fed-upon corpse. She can attempt to Recall Knowledge using any Lore as if she has legendary proficiency with it ([[/r 1d20+26 #Recall Knowledge]]{+26} on the check).

Ashes of Despair.name: Blood Lords
Ashes of Despair.description: Swirling ashes fill the room and form into the semblance of a massive predatory bird that swoops upon those in the chamber, draining their life force away.
Ashes of Despair.hazardDisable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:44] (master) to disrupt and counteract the shadow magic animating the ashes, or @Check[type:religion|dc:42] (master) to exorcise the animating spirit. Disabling the trap requires three successful checks, in any combination of Occultism and Religion checks.
Ashes of Despair.hazardReset: The haunt resets immediately when there are no creatures in area F9. Any previous successes from attempts to Disable the haunt persist when it's later triggered. After three successes, the haunt doesn't reset.
Ashes of Despair.hazardRoutine:
(1 action) The shadowy shape sends streams of scouring ash toward the mouth, eyes, and nose of each creature in the room, dealing [[/r (3d12+20)[slashing]]] damage and requiring a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:42] save. Creatures that don't need breathe can't be sickened by the haunt and creatures that don't see can't be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} by it.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage and is blinded for 1 round.

Success The creature takes half damage, is blinded for 1 round, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage, is blinded for 1 minute, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage, is blinded for 1 minute, is sickened 2, and is unable to use any spells or abilities with the verbal trait while it is sickened.

lvyX8fE28Dyfd4Qs.name: Battering Defense
lvyX8fE28Dyfd4Qs.description: The Bellator Mortus uses their shield as both a weapon and a defensive measure. Attempt a shield Strike. If the Strike hits, Raise a Shield.

jeVTUAjLCW0Tbgfl.name: Coordinated Assault
jeVTUAjLCW0Tbgfl.description: The Bellator Mortus acts as part of a well-trained unit. Their Strikes deal an additional 4d6 damage to creatures within reach of at least one of the Bellator Mortus's allies.

Vanth Warrior.name: Vanth Warrior
Vanth Warrior.description: Protecting the Boneyard are the stern and resolute guardians of the dead known as vanths, psychopomps who resemble skeletons with raven-like wings and a mask resembling a vulture's skull. Vanths carry black scythes to fight against those who would disturb the natural progression of souls, and they consider any visitor to the Boneyard a potential troublemaker. When the psychopomp armies go to war, vanths serve as front-line soldiers. They rarely speak and even more rarely show any emotion other than a grim adherence to duty.
Vanth Warrior.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

de7GnRXapzBCdDoL.name: Infuse Weapon
de7GnRXapzBCdDoL.description: A vanth's scythe is their symbol of office and gains a measure of their personal power. This scythe becomes a +2 striking scythe and is treated as if it were adamantine while the vanth wields it. A vanth whose scythe is taken or destroyed can infuse a new one with an hour of work.

inmnuN3VcUuUDTaX.name: Reaping Scythe
inmnuN3VcUuUDTaX.description: The vanth throws their scythe, which flies in a @Template[type:line|distance:60], dealing [[/r 6d8[slashing]]] damage to all creatures in the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:34|basic:true]) and returns to the vanth's hand.

oBV1Ybwqj4dpXeff.name: Spirit Touch
oBV1Ybwqj4dpXeff.description: A vanth's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a ghost touch property rune and deal [[/r 3d6[negative]]] damage to living creatures and [[/r 3d6[positive]]] damage to undead.

Sep8lU0AriLntZmy.name: Vanth's Curse
Sep8lU0AriLntZmy.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The vanth bestows a curse on a creature by touching it with their scythe. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:34] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Vanth's Curse for 24 hours.

Success The target feels a momentary shudder of doom and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute by the distracting sensation.

Failure The target becomes morose and glum as it accepts its own inevitable fate. For 1 hour, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3}. Each time the target gains the dying condition, the stupefied value increases by 1, to a maximum value of stupefied 6.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effect is permanent.

Kelganth.name: Kelganth
Kelganth.description:
A wizard whose insatiable desire for arcane power eclipsed their mortal life, the lich is a truly devious and versatile spellcaster.

To gain more time to complete their goals, some desperate spellcasters pursue immortality by embracing undeath. After long years of research and the creation of a special container called a phylactery, a spellcaster takes the final step by imbibing a deadly concoction or casting dreadful incantations that transform them into a lich. While most undertake this drastic plan to continue their work or fulfill some long-term plan, others become liches because they fear death or to fulfill some malevolent purpose, such as long-sworn revenge. Regardless, the result is permanent and carries with it the potential to alter history-both that of those who transform themselves and of the countless mortals that will inevitably suffer as a result of a lich's new power.

After its metamorphosis, a lich often finds some quiet place to dwell, typically protected by a variety of guardians and traps, for two primary purposes. First, a lich requires solitude in order to plan its elaborate schemes, and second, few mortals (if any) deign to interact with these legendarily corrupt necromancers. One reason begets the other, as the self-imposed isolation of a lich often drives the lich insane, further solidifying its separation from civilization. The longer a lich lives, the more meticulous a planner it becomes, secreting itself within a labyrinth of deadly puzzles, misdirection, and monsters. A lich's servants and guardians are absolutely loyal, either due to their nature (such as constructs or other undead) or as a result of compulsion using powerful magic. Many liches go mad, in time, and the nature of a lich's lair is a good indicator of the undead's current mental state.

For all the protections it arrays around itself, a lich will go to greater lengths to guard its phylactery, as it knows that the destruction of this magical container spells doom for the lich. A lich is notoriously difficult to bargain with, though the threat of damaging its phylactery is a sure way to gain the upper hand in such a negotiation.
Kelganth.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. positive

gakDYFEsPKyFUdIg.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Positive

gSG1OZxFHX2zLrNP.name: Counterspell
gSG1OZxFHX2zLrNP.description:
Trigger A creature casts a spell Kelganth has prepared

Effect Kelganth expends a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. Kelganth loses his spell slot as if he had cast the triggering spell.

m6CbK52GoU471gez.name: Drain Soul Cage
m6CbK52GoU471gez.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Kelganth taps into his @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage's} power to cast any arcane spell up to 9th level, even if the spell being cast is not one of his prepared spells. Kelganth's soul cage doesn't need to be present for him to use this ability.

O8JRZ8ZAEwNxvyR1.name: Font of Death
O8JRZ8ZAEwNxvyR1.description: The tomb giant turns the spiritual tide on a creature that has just died, temporarily transforming it into a volatile vessel of negative energy. The tomb giant touches a creature that died in the past 24 hours, infusing its flesh and bone with negative energy. Once during the next hour, the tomb giant can spend a single action (from any distance) to release this negative energy from the corpse in an explosion that deals [[/r 11d12[negative]]] damage in a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:41|basic:true]); if not released before the end of the hour, the energy dissipates harmlessly. The tomb giant can't use Font of Death while a previous corpse remains infused.

CUwhBzgJAPCU9WcT.name: Paralyzing Doom
CUwhBzgJAPCU9WcT.description: A creature damaged by Kelganth's hand Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:41] save. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round on a failure. On a critical failure, the creature is paralyzed permanently, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and seems dead. A @Check[type:medicine|dc:25] check reveals that the victim is alive.

z7kqAkB367vaH1Zy.name: Quickened Casting
z7kqAkB367vaH1Zy.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect If Kelganth's next action is to cast an cantrip or spell that is 8th level or less, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

5TLoRDxeWBDh6a6e.name: Steady Spellcasting
5TLoRDxeWBDh6a6e.description: If a reaction would disrupt Kelganth's spellcasting action, he attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

pj2PzMSNP3aGSaFR.name: Stench
pj2PzMSNP3aGSaFR.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened on a critical failure).

While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.wX9L6fbqVMLP05hn]{Effect: Stench}

VFhfoXbwgIId8hxa.name: Consume Flesh
VFhfoXbwgIId8hxa.description:
Requirements The ghast is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghast devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r 6d6[healing]]]{6d6 Hit Points}

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

zGemjvWNZRYrlrdm.name: Ghast Fever
zGemjvWNZRYrlrdm.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r 3d8[negative]]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r 3d8[negative]]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.VC7rtYR4hLxwg7WZ]{Ghast} the next midnight

fvNa9q4DAn2iRbMf.name: Paralysis
fvNa9q4DAn2iRbMf.description: Any living creature hit by a ghast's attack must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

G13LX7IIeKwacGfa.description:
The ghast's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

ylEXl7NSakJ1G8mo.name: Swift Leap
ylEXl7NSakJ1G8mo.description: The ghast jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

JmyxIQQcJZ0SdqMM.name: Bone Key to the Basement Tunnels (Area A8)

6TyxpLhpnbTQuAxd.name: Hatred of Red
6TyxpLhpnbTQuAxd.description: Pairakas hate the color red. They won't wear the color or willingly enter any place painted red. Given a choice, they'll attack a creature wearing red first. If barred from expressing their displeasure toward the color by force or some magical effect, they take [[/r 2d6[mental]]] damage at the end of their turn.

QblktZpnGuwZyRoE.name: Bubonic Plague
QblktZpnGuwZyRoE.description:
A creature can't remove the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} condition while infected

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 fatigued (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and fatigued (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}, fatigued, and take [[/r 1d6[bleed]]] damage every [[/br 1d20 #Minutes]] minutes (1 day)

3NHzkM0Zz6Qhyfrx.description:
Yshula can take the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid or animal. This doesn't change his Speed or his attack and damage modifiers with the Strikes, but it might change the damage type his strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

UTkWE4ZUCzqoWE6Z.name: Cottage-Drained
UTkWE4ZUCzqoWE6Z.description: Yshula is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and can't recover from his drained condition while he's in the cottage. These reductions are included in his statistics.

O03HMHG7y11WSzQJ.name: Tormenting Dreams
O03HMHG7y11WSzQJ.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Yshula torments a sleeping creature within 100 feet with visions of betrayals by loved ones and friends. The target must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:25] save, with the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare} spell.

THTZ70glpYi6EuWC.name: Chug
THTZ70glpYi6EuWC.description:
Requirements The brewer is holding a flagon of ale

Effect The brewer Interacts to quickly quaff the flagon's contents. For 1 minute, the brewer gains a +2 item bonus to Athletics checks, damage rolls, and saving throws against fear, but becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.zBbmuudbWY8FaOwZ]{Effect: Chug}

OJuNHnHd0dRzaSgt.name: Hasty Impediment
OJuNHnHd0dRzaSgt.description:
Requirements The brewer is adjacent to a barrel, crate, chair, table, or similar wooden object

Effect The brewer heaves the object up to 15 feet and it breaks, sending splinters in a @Template[type:burst|distance:5]. Each creature in the area of splinters takes [[/r 2d6[piercing]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:14|basic:true]), and the area becomes difficult terrain.

4jCvZADBa2etfzw7.name: Warded Ground
4jCvZADBa2etfzw7.description: The guard designates a @Template[type:burst|distance:10]{10-foot radius} area within 30 feet as a protected zone. The guard's Strikes against targets in the protected zone deal an additional 2d6 precision damage.

2VjzSO1Lu2NfxSvA.name: Devastator
2VjzSO1Lu2NfxSvA.description: Grace's Strikes ignore 10 points of a creature's resistance to physical damage.

g08HVYQyr4BtWYzK.name: Celestial Rage
g08HVYQyr4BtWYzK.description:
Requirements Grace isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or raging

Effect Grace unleashes her inner fury. She gains 20 temporary Hit Points that last until her Celestial Rage ends and she casts one divine innate spell or focus spell she knows. While raging, she gains weakness to evil 10, gains a +10-foot status bonus to her Speed, and takes a -1 penalty to AC. She can't use actions with the concentrate trait unless they also have the rage trait. This Celestial Rage lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies Grace can perceive, or until she falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, whichever comes first. When the Celestial Rage ends, Grace can't use Celestial Rage again for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Celestial Rage}

K2vHWqScxNJnWnUH.name: Great Cleave
K2vHWqScxNJnWnUH.description: When Grace's melee Strike reduces a creature to 0 Hit Points, she can make a melee Strike against another foe adjacent to that creature. If that Strike also reduces the creature to 0 Hit Points, she can continue making melee Strikes until she makes a Strike that doesn't reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points, or until there are no creatures adjacent to the most recent creature she attacked while cleaving, whichever comes first.

5nVE2Xaxc35lkDA5.name: Rhino Charge
5nVE2Xaxc35lkDA5.description: Grace Strides twice; if she ends her movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, she can make a melee Strike against that enemy. Grace can Fly instead of Stride if she has a fly speed (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.kRsmUlSWhi6PJvZ7]{Angelic Wings}).

Perilous Flash Flood.name: Blood Lords
Perilous Flash Flood.description: Whether made up of water rushing through the streets that sweeps up dangerous debris along the way or a less natural substance bursting free of its container, this relentless flood batters everything in its path.
Perilous Flash Flood.hazardDisable: Three @Check[type:athletics|dc:35|name:Move Barricade], @Check[type:crafting|dc:35|name:Construct Barricade], or @Check[type:survival|dc:35|name:Construct Barricade] checks to move or construct barricades strong enough to create a shelter from the flood. While this creates a safe place to stand, creatures outside of the barricaded area may still be in danger depending on the nature and the source of the flood.
Perilous Flash Flood.hazardRoutine:
(1 action) The flood advances forward 60 feet, crashing into all creatures within its area. Each creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30] save as the floodwaters pummel them and pull them downstream. The amount and type of damage dealt are based on the nature of the flood, and certain types of floods impose additional effects. The turbulent waters mean creatures within the area of the flood must attempt a @Check[type:athletics|dc:20|name:Swim|traits:action:swim] check to Swim in order to move, and those who do not succeed at a check to Swim each round may drown.

This caustic flood dissolves flesh as it moves, dealing [[/r {1d12[bludgeoning],(1d12+8)[acid]}]]{1d12 bludgeoning damage and 1d12+8 acid damage}. Additionally, it deals [[/r 2d6[persistent,acid]]] damage to creatures who critically fail their Fortitude saves.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is moved 10 feet along with the water.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is moved 20 feet along with the water.

Shadow Leydroth.name: Shadow Leydroth
Shadow Leydroth.description:
In ancient times, a cabal of primalists imbued an amalgam of beasts with both supernatural might and a hatred of magic itself, hoping to achieve a potent weapon for use against arcane spellcasters. Effective beyond expectation, the first leydroths broke free and turned on their creators. Worse, the leydroths bred true, and these reclusive predators have long outlived their original creators.

Leydroths look like distorted, apelike felines with many-branching horns growing from the backs of their heads. Their thickly muscled limbs end in glowing claws.
Shadow Leydroth.npcAllSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

OlwLivQfLQIh0ut7.name: Magic Sense
OlwLivQfLQIh0ut7.description: The leydroth detects the source and school of each source of magic within 60 feet as an imprecise sense.

dKevXPU98KPaR2FZ.name: Slink in Shadows
dKevXPU98KPaR2FZ.description: The Shadow Leydroth can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or end its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in a creature's or object's shadow.

JxE1ccJO8ctrpivc.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

fKqimVsLOPsE2xN0.name: Menace to Magic
fKqimVsLOPsE2xN0.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet Casts a Spell

Effect The leydroth attempts an Intimidation check to counteract the triggering spell.

Ixt0Bpsg2FgwTGiy.name: Dispelling Roar
Ixt0Bpsg2FgwTGiy.description:
The leydroth unleashes a bestial roar that reverberates within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. It rolls an Intimidation check and compares the result to the Will DC of each creature in the area, with the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}.

It also uses this result to attempt to counteract each spell or magical effect in the area, plus one item or effect on each creature in the area, with the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}.

The leydroth can't use Dispelling Roar again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Q3683RHwk5skFzWi.name: Dispelling Strike
Q3683RHwk5skFzWi.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger The leydroth hits a creature, object, or spell effect with a Strike

Effect The leydroth casts its innate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}, targeting one effect on the creature struck.

j4OHhvOuFnXfbDjB.name: Spell Feedback
j4OHhvOuFnXfbDjB.description: Any time a leydroth counteracts a spell or item, the spell's caster or the creature holding the item takes [[/r 8d6[mental]]] damage (@Check[type:will|dc:38|basic:true] save).

Urbulinex.name: Urbulinex
Urbulinex.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
Urbulinex.npcSenses: greater darkvision, scent (imprecise) 60 feet, soulsense 60 feet

0dTEwPV9TXqDzFno.name: Soulsense 60 feet
0dTEwPV9TXqDzFno.description: A ravener senses the spiritual essence of living and undead creatures within the listed range. Creatures whose material bodies are one unit with their souls, like celestials and fiends, appear brighter to this sense.

fKSG7vK6L1fcFNmE.name: Cowering Fear
fKSG7vK6L1fcFNmE.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:90]{90 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura} @Check[type:will|dc:37]

A ravener's frightful presence causes creatures to cower in fear as well. As long as a creature is at least @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} or more as a result of the ravener's frightful presence, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} from the fear.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

lfixSUcyvIdrZqF1.name: Soul Ward
lfixSUcyvIdrZqF1.description:
An intangible field of necromantic energy protects a ravener from total destruction. A soul ward has 150 maximum Hit Points.

Whenever a ravener would be reduced below 1 Hit Point, all damage in excess of what would reduce them to 1 Hit Point is instead dealt to their soul ward. If this damage reduces the soul ward to fewer than 0 Hit Points, the ravener is destroyed.

A soul ward's Hit Points can be restored only via specific ravener abilities such as Consume Soul, ravenous breath, or vicious criticals. A ravener who goes more than a week without successfully using Consume Soul to feed on a dying creature starves, and their soul ward loses [[/r {1d4} #Soul Ward Decay]]{1d4 Hit Points} each day until they feed. If the ravener's soul ward loses all its Hit Points while the ravener still has more than 1 HP, they become a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.Yv0005Vym1peVKHq]{Ravener Husk}.

VThOAv0PEn1ai8J3.name: Consume Soul
VThOAv0PEn1ai8J3.description:
Trigger A living creature within 30 feet of the ravener dies

Effect The ravener tears the creature's soul from its body with their maw and gulps it down. The dying creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:44|name:Consume Soul] save with the same DC as the ravener's Breath Weapon.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The ravener tears off a small chunk of the creature's soul. If the victim is restored to life, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} in addition to any other side effects of returning to life. The ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to half the creature's level.

Failure As success, but the creature's soul is ravaged. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} and the ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to the creature's level.

Critical Failure As failure, but the ravener devours the entire soul. The victim can't be restored to life as long as the ravener exists except via a 10th-level effect such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}, and the ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to twice the creature's level.

SzH0hxHyBlvwORAO.name: Draconic Frenzy
SzH0hxHyBlvwORAO.description: The ravener makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order.

jprnheEoj1wr3ahE.name: Draconic Momentum
jprnheEoj1wr3ahE.description: The ravener recharges their Breath Weapon whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

KULBffXE7IRa4JWU.name: Ghost Bane
KULBffXE7IRa4JWU.description: The ravener's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a ghost touch property rune, and the ravener's jaws deal an additional [[/r 6d6[force]]] damage to undead.

SSJYmiOBRjHkg1Qt.name: Ravenous Breath Weapon
SSJYmiOBRjHkg1Qt.description:
The ravener breathes in one of two ways. With either option, a creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure). If at least one creature is drained by the ravener's Ravenous Breath Weapon, the ravener's soul ward gains 5 HP. The ravener can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Negative (necromancy, negative, primal) The ravener breathes a blast of darkness in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] that deals [[/r 17d6[negative]]] damage plus [[/r 4d6[persistent,negative]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:39|basic:true|traits:necromancy,primal,negative]). Undead creatures take [[/r 22d6[force]]] damage instead of the negative damage.
  • Shadows (necromancy, primal, shadow) The ravener breathes a blast of shadows in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40]. Each creature within the cone must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:39|traits:necromancy,primal,shadow] save.

    Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

    Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 round.

    Failure The creature is enfeebled 2 for 1 minute.

    Critical Failure The creature is enfeebled 2 for 1 minute and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

YzCBJTb2mBGfoo0v.name: Vicious Criticals
YzCBJTb2mBGfoo0v.description:
The ravener treats an attack roll as a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20, as long as the attack roll was a success. Additionally, whenever the ravener makes a critical hit with one of their Strikes, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:37] save or gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} condition. If the target already has a drained value of greater than 0, their drained value instead increases by 1, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}. Whenever the ravener applies drain to a creature in this way, their soul ward gains 5 Hit Points.

Note: A DC was not provided for this ability by Paizo. The DC present here is a moderate DC for the creature level according to the Gamemastery Guide creature building Tables.

Unfinished Portalrender.name: Blood Lords
Unfinished Portalrender.description: A sphere of concentrated agony harvested from a qlippoth begins pulsing with violet light as it blasts the room with otherworldly agony.
Unfinished Portalrender.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:37] (master) to dismantle the housing and refocus the agony inward so it consumes itself harmlessly, @Check[type:arcana|dc:33] or @Check[type:occultism|dc:33] (master) to vent the agony in a controlled way that causes the portalrender to become inert after 1 minute (during which it can still be triggered normally), or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th level; counteract DC 31)
Unfinished Portalrender.hazardRoutine: The unfinished portalrender continues to flood area B4 with agony, and everyone in the room must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:33] save against its Agonizing Pulse. At the end of its turn, the unfinished portalrender attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:6]. On a failure, its stores of agony deplete and it deactivates, causing the central orb of agony to fade away permanently.

Skewering Hall.name: Blood Lords
Skewering Hall.description: A dozen spears hidden within sockets in the walls thrust into the hall when the pressure plate is triggered.

dUKNUHl6zUilhtbR.name: Bardic Lore
dUKNUHl6zUilhtbR.description: Sphinxes are naturally curious, and their love of puzzles and mysteries leads them to gather information on a broad range of topics. Sphinxes have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.uVXEZblPRuCyPRua]{Bardic Lore} bard feat, allowing them to Recall Knowledge on any topic.

jW0IBuqnVeRIa4tt.name: Aquatic Assault
jW0IBuqnVeRIa4tt.description: Basiri Swims and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If both she and her opponent are submerged underwater, she can Strike one additional time.

5m851MBF5JZspKoX.name: Harness Wellspring
5m851MBF5JZspKoX.description: Basiri draws upon the necromantic wellspring to power her spellcasting. During her turn, she gains the ability to cast one of the following spells, heightened to 9th level: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.PHVHBbdHeQRfjLmE]{Spirit Blast} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Ht35SDf9PDStJfoC]{Spirit Song}.

EGCqTcy88a9ny4va.name: Wellspring Guardian
EGCqTcy88a9ny4va.description: Once per day, Basiri can protect the necromantic wellspring by inscribing a magical sigil around the wellspring orrery. The first time a creature other than Basiri touches the orrery, that creature must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:41|traits:occult,spell,force,necromancy] save or be affected by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.PHVHBbdHeQRfjLmE]{Spirit Blast} (9th).

Soul-Drinking Spirit Collectors.name: Blood Lords
Soul-Drinking Spirit Collectors.description: Four spirit collectors drain the souls from nearby creatures.
Soul-Drinking Spirit Collectors.hazardDisable: @Check[type:religion|dc:47] (legendary) to sever the connection between Urgathoa and each spirit collector, @Check[type:thievery|dc:50] (legendary) to deactivate each spirit collector, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level; counteract DC 50) to counteract each spirit collector
Soul-Drinking Spirit Collectors.hazardRoutine: (4 actions) This trap loses 1 action each turn for each disabled spirit collector. Each spirit collector uses 1 action to drain the souls of all creatures within 30 feet, dealing [[/r (4d10+20)[force]]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:46|basic:true]). On a failed save, a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} or increases their drained and stupefied conditions by 1 (by 2 on a critical failure).

Kepgeda's Keening Cauldron.name: Blood Lords
Kepgeda's Keening Cauldron.description: The cauldron's ear-splitting keening calls forth spectral claws to assail ears and souls alike.
Kepgeda's Keening Cauldron.hazardDisable: @Check[type:athletics|dc:22] to tip the cauldron, or @Check[type:occultism|dc:20] or @Check[type:religion|dc:20] (trained) to ward against the cauldron's effects. Any combination of three successful attempts is required to fully disable the haunt. When the haunt is disabled, the coven seeks vengeance.
Kepgeda's Keening Cauldron.hazardReset: The haunt becomes inert (resuming its usual screaming) at the end of any round in which no creatures other than Kepgeda remain in her kitchen.
Kepgeda's Keening Cauldron.hazardRoutine: (1 action) The spectral hands scurry about, grabbing at all of Kepgeda's foes in area E13. Each such creature takes [[/r 3d6[mental]]] damage (@Check[type:will|dc:20|basic:true]) as the spectral claws assail them. A creature that takes mental damage from this effect doesn't reduce their frightened value at the end of their next turn.

Summoning Rune (Cockatrice).name: Blood Lords
Summoning Rune (Cockatrice).description: A cloud of invisible magical sensors floats in the square above an invisible floor rune.
Summoning Rune (Cockatrice).hazardDisable: @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:18] to approach without triggering the trap followed by @Check[type:thievery|dc:20] (trained) to disrupt the rune's summoning effect; alternatively, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd level; counteract DC 17) to counteract the rune

Sorvinaesen.name: Sorvinaesen
Sorvinaesen.description:
Masters of mausoleums and keepers of crypts, the dread creatures called tomb giants are anathema to all living beings, but especially so to other types of giants. Long ago, so the legends say, tomb giants sold their souls in exchange for unfathomable necromantic powers. With whom they made this foul bargain remains a mystery-if the rumors hold any truth at all. Still, tomb giants' power over undeath remains undeniable, and nearly all of them embrace a fervent passion for necromancy.

Tomb giants construct massive gothic settlements in haunted valleys and on forsaken hillsides, far enough away from the societies of smaller people that they remain relatively undisturbed, but close enough that they can raid the graveyards of nearby villages with impunity.

Elder tomb giants-those who have animated countless hordes of humanoid zombies and skeletons and yearn for even greater challenges-enjoy the thrill of subduing, slaying, and reanimating their fellow giants. Taiga giants in particular are choice prey to an experienced tomb giant, as their larger cousins make formidable undead guardians and warriors.

A tomb giant views its mortal life as only one part of its existence. After death, most tomb giants are themselves reanimated as undead, who then continue to practice their necromantic arts.

Many kinds of giants lurk in the inhospitable corners of the world, making their homes in unlikely locales ranging from fetid sinkholes and ruined battlefields to mass graveyards and barren badlands.

NadsS6KEYWE2sb2U.name: Small Bag of Ash Containing a Black Onyx Gem

ghavKYYcFvQxKQ3n.name: Font of Death
ghavKYYcFvQxKQ3n.description: The tomb giant turns the spiritual tide on a creature that has just died, temporarily transforming it into a volatile vessel of negative energy. The tomb giant touches a creature that died in the past 24 hours, infusing its flesh and bone with negative energy. Once during the next hour, the tomb giant can spend a single action (from any distance) to release this negative energy from the corpse in an explosion that deals [[/r 10d12[negative]]] damage energy in a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:36|basic:true] save); if not released before the end of the hour, the energy dissipates harmlessly. The tomb giant can't use Font of Death while a previous corpse remains infused.

sKizGnItFf8dn6kf.name: Impart Doom
sKizGnItFf8dn6kf.description: A creature hit by Sorvinaesen's claw Strike, or one who critically fails a save from one of Sorvinaesen's spells, becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

U9NiBmIUjYGYkzVA.name: Visions of Death
U9NiBmIUjYGYkzVA.description: Sorvinaesen's Strikes deal an additional [[/r 2d10[mental]]] damage to doomed creatures as visions of their impending deaths fill their minds.

Vampire Guardian.name: Vampire Guardian
Vampire Guardian.npcHp: coffin restoration, fast healing 10, negative healing

Y23JOg9qOtShESZg.name: Change Shape
Y23JOg9qOtShESZg.description:
The vampire transforms into one of its animal forms or back into its normal form. Most vampires can turn into a bat, but some can turn into a different creature, such as a rat or a wolf.

Use the options in the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.NzXpEzcZAjuDTZjK]{Aerial Form} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.wp09USMB3GIW1qbp]{Animal Form} spells as guidelines.

  • Bat The vampire changes into a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.VAWmwDA08ZLQd8lW]{Bat Swarm} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.C9s5tBxVValC2HTE]{Giant Bat}. It gains echolocation 40 feet, a land Speed of 20 feet and a fly Speed of 30 feet, and a fangs Strike with a +21 attack bonus. These fangs deal the same amount of damage as the vampire's claws, but deal piercing damage rather than slashing damage.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

HB6xi0BkiG2sC4sk.name: Dominate
HB6xi0BkiG2sC4sk.description:
The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait. A creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

EUkVu0jdkqrrm4E4.name: Drink Blood
EUkVu0jdkqrrm4E4.description:
Requirement A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an Athletics check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the vampire regains [[/r 13[healing]]]{13 Hit Points}, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[type:medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

Jq2usNoNnsU6K6FR.description:
A vampire guardian deals 1d6 extra precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

RRtEbi7LCsYVcq0p.name: Entangling Net
RRtEbi7LCsYVcq0p.description: A Sallowdrudge uses their net to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a Medium or smaller creature within 30 feet. On a success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} until it Escapes (DC 16) or until an adjacent creature Interacts to remove the net. On a critical hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} rather than grabbed. The Sallowdrudge can't use Entangling Net again until they take 1 minute to refold their net.

YvpiKlId2of8rjcZ.name: Spear Fisher
YvpiKlId2of8rjcZ.description: A Sallowdrudge attacking an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} target rolls the attack roll twice and takes the better result.

cLS7heYyAi8HMhyc.description: This mobile collection of vials and chemicals can be used for simple alchemical tasks.

D1cMaK9JDg78UTKJ.name: Infused Items
D1cMaK9JDg78UTKJ.description: Pesgahi carries the following infused items, which last for 24 hours or until the next time he makes his daily preparations: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.ktjFOp3U0wQD9t0Z]{Antidote (Lesser)} (2), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.MoBlVd36uD9xVvZC]{Smokestick (Lesser)} (2), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Acid Flask (Moderate)} (6), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.nVvH1ZcM7OwIVIs8]{Frost Vial (Moderate)} (4)

6vv0VDnWbHi1JTse.name: Consume Flesh
6vv0VDnWbHi1JTse.description:
Requirements Pesgahi is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect Pesgahi devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r 2d6[healing]]]{2d6 Hit Points}.

He can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

AfDO8pafi2fzO6LF.name: Ghoul Fever
AfDO8pafi2fzO6LF.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r 2d6[negative]]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r 2d6[negative]]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

OlYMKu8U3252vjmq.name: Paralysis
OlYMKu8U3252vjmq.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by Pesgahi's attack must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

E0P6jMbhRa8iA1xN.name: Quick Bomber
E0P6jMbhRa8iA1xN.description: Pesgahi can use Interact to draw a bomb and then Strike with it.

4ucQqsarDzmNeEnw.name: Swift Leap
4ucQqsarDzmNeEnw.description: Pesgahi jumps up to half his Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

zGqC1f9nAbkhFc9Q.name: Iron Command
zGqC1f9nAbkhFc9Q.description:
Trigger An enemy within 15 feet damages Seldeg

Effect Seldeg puts an impertinent foe who dared harm him in their proper place. He commands the enemy to kneel in obedience. If they refuse, they must pay the price in pain and anguish. The triggering creature must choose one of the following options: the enemy kneels, dropping @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} as a free action, or the enemy refuses and takes [[/r 5d6[mental]]] damage. In addition, Seldeg's Strikes against the triggering creature deal an additional 3 damage until the end of his next turn. Seldeg chooses whether the additional damage is evil or negative each time he uses this reaction.

vmaElwLfTTptfaGk.name: Sacrilegious Aura
vmaElwLfTTptfaGk.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

When a creature in the aura uses a positive spell or ability, the graveknight automatically attempts to counteract it, with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+27 #Counteract]]{+27}.

QHX8JgZjpxQ71msf.name: Devastating Blast
QHX8JgZjpxQ71msf.description: Seldeg unleashes a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of fire. Creatures in the area take [[/r 9d12[fire]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:35|basic:true]). Seldeg can use this ability once every [[/r 1d4 #Devastating Blast Recharge]]{1d4 rounds}.

sflDAvsA8PP3Jp11.name: Graveknight's Curse
sflDAvsA8PP3Jp11.description:
This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour.

Saving Throw @Check[type:will|dc:35] save

Onset 1 hour

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and cannot remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, the creature's Speed is reduced by 10, and cannot remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 3 dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.6rnB7nK6J6zF4vea]{Effect: Graveknight's Curse}

kyx1GW0W2F4XknIb.name: Phantom Steed
kyx1GW0W2F4XknIb.description:
HP 130; AC 39, Fort +28, Ref +25, Will +22

Seldeg summons a supernatural mount as per @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.WPKJOhEihhcIm2uQ]{Phantom Steed} (8th level). Unlike phantom steed, the steed's AC and saving throw bonuses are all 4 levels lower than Seldeg's, and the steed has one-third of Seldeg's Hit Points (rounded down). If the steed is destroyed, Seldeg must wait 1 hour before using this ability again.

gElZJHj913X1orQh.name: Ruinous Weapons
gElZJHj913X1orQh.description: Any weapon or unarmed attack Seldeg uses gains the effects of the +1 greater striking and greater flaming runes.

DOr8AePD22yCeJqd.name: Unyielding Block
DOr8AePD22yCeJqd.description: At the start of each of Seldeg's turns, he gains two additional reactions he can use only to perform a Shield Block.

Charghar.name: Charghar
Charghar.description:
Common urban legends in Geb warn of the vengeful spirits of those who've been cooked alive, collectively called charghars. While many Gebbites eat people in ways that don't involve cooking, there are some undead who've grown bored after centuries of the same diet. There are also some living people in the nation who've resorted to cannibalism: either downtrodden folks who cook and eat their neighbors and kin out of necessity, or socialites who dine on such fare because it's fashionable.
