Regardless of the reason for cooking people, these efforts can create vengeful undead creatures who lurk wherever meals are being prepared, luring cooks into making careless or deadly mistakes.

Charghars have spectral humanoid forms, while their physical manifestations appear much as they did after they were cooked-as charred remains, gory corpses bearing disembodied butchered chunks that float nearby, or loose assemblages of boiled bones.

jSYDiFX6EjzvYaVs.name: Malevolent Mishaps
jSYDiFX6EjzvYaVs.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The charghar causes clumsiness and uncertainty in those nearby. Each creature that starts its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:21] save.

Success The creature is temporarily immune to Malevolent Mishaps for 1 minute.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the start of its next turn. If the creature is living, the charghar Imparts Fears.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

qCZ93XZdw1VOY0cY.name: Create Spawn
qCZ93XZdw1VOY0cY.description: Any humanoid creature killed by a charghar and left unburied in the vicinity of a stove, oven, cauldron, or similar object rises as a free-willed charghar at the next dawn.

HHdOAo37LMBn63w4.name: Impart Fears
HHdOAo37LMBn63w4.description:
A living creature that is struck by a charghar's ghostly cookware Strike or fails a saving throw against the charghar's malevolent mishaps must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:21] save. A creature affected by Impart Fears can attempt a new saving throw each day to remove the effect.

Success The creature is temporarily immune to Impart Fears for 24 hours.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} each time it ingests anything or takes an action to prepare any food or drink.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}, and the creature can't reduce its frightened condition below 1.

lGLvct1KPSexucot.name: Wing Buffet
lGLvct1KPSexucot.description:
Trigger An adjacent creature attacks the kapoacinth while the kapoacinth is Swimming

Effect The kapoacinth pushes the triggering creature 5 feet away from them, and the kapoacinth moves 10 feet in the opposite direction. If the triggering creature can no longer attack the kapoacinth from its new location, the attack misses.

dRMCIL9tHEatSIqt.name: Coral Reef
dRMCIL9tHEatSIqt.description: Until the next time they act, the kapoacinth appears to be a lump of coral. They have an automatic result of 31 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as coral.

Castigate the Faithless.name: Blood Lords
Castigate the Faithless.description: Magic forces those who pass by the statue to the ground with sudden force; pressing the bypass button deactivates the trap for 1 minute.
Castigate the Faithless.hazardDisable: @Check[type:religion|dc:47] (legendary) to deactivate the trap through prayer, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 47) to counteract the trap, or press the bypass button
Castigate the Faithless.hazardReset: The trap resets automatically if triggered, after 1 minute if the bypass button is pressed, or after 15 minutes if disabled or counteracted.

dFFv9RiIxSIhrXJ6.name: Slow
dFFv9RiIxSIhrXJ6.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

2KvJH5DlBNKZ3xwD.name: Chomp at the Bone
2KvJH5DlBNKZ3xwD.description:
Requirements The zombie horse's previous action was a jaws Strike that dealt damage to its target

Effect the zombie horse makes a second jaws Strike as it violently gnashes its teeth and bites deep into the target's flesh. On a success, the target takes an additional @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d4.success].

D6B66UdCjYK3Ln2m.name: Feast
D6B66UdCjYK3Ln2m.description: If the zombie horse is adjacent to a helpless or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature, or a deceased creature that died in the past hour, the zombie can feast upon its flesh to heal itself. This restores [[/r 1[healing]]]{1 Hit Point}. If the creature is alive, the zombie horse deals damage equal to its jaws damage.

Agorron Guard.name: Agorron Guard
Agorron Guard.description:
Masters of mausoleums and keepers of crypts, the dread creatures called tomb giants are anathema to all living beings, but especially so to other types of giants. Long ago, so the legends say, tomb giants sold their souls in exchange for unfathomable necromantic powers. With whom they made this foul bargain remains a mystery-if the rumors hold any truth at all. Still, tomb giants' power over undeath remains undeniable, and nearly all of them embrace a fervent passion for necromancy.

Tomb giants construct massive gothic settlements in haunted valleys and on forsaken hillsides, far enough away from the societies of smaller people that they remain relatively undisturbed, but close enough that they can raid the graveyards of nearby villages with impunity.

Elder tomb giants-those who have animated countless hordes of humanoid zombies and skeletons and yearn for even greater challenges-enjoy the thrill of subduing, slaying, and reanimating their fellow giants. Taiga giants in particular are choice prey to an experienced tomb giant, as their larger cousins make formidable undead guardians and warriors.

A tomb giant views its mortal life as only one part of its existence. After death, most tomb giants are themselves reanimated as undead, who then continue to practice their necromantic arts.

Many kinds of giants lurk in the inhospitable corners of the world, making their homes in unlikely locales ranging from fetid sinkholes and ruined battlefields to mass graveyards and barren badlands.

sKizGnItFf8dn6kf.name: Dooming Touch
sKizGnItFf8dn6kf.description: The Agorron guard's claws carry the accursed power of their foul gods. A creature hit by the guard's claw Strike becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

ghavKYYcFvQxKQ3n.name: Font of Death
ghavKYYcFvQxKQ3n.description: The tomb giant turns the spiritual tide on a creature that has just died, temporarily transforming it into a volatile vessel of negative energy. The tomb giant touches a creature that died in the past 24 hours, infusing its flesh and bone with negative energy. Once during the next hour, the tomb giant can spend a single action (from any distance) to release this negative energy from the corpse in an explosion that deals [[/r 10d10[negative]]] damage energy in a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:36|basic:true] save); if not released before the end of the hour, the energy dissipates harmlessly. The tomb giant can't use Font of Death while a previous corpse remains infused.

k4X0vQBrs8WZ3tEV.name: Wicked Blow
k4X0vQBrs8WZ3tEV.description: The Agorron guard makes a Strike with their scythe. A creature damaged by this attack takes [[/r 3d6[bleed]]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

R9XRTrjfJ6f0YE1W.name: Key to all locks in Cerulean Glade

wOjnTOBFA1g6tffb.name: Wand of Cone of Cold (Level 5)
wOjnTOBFA1g6tffb.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.3puDanGfpEt6jK5k]

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated level.

Craft Requirements Supply a listed-level casting of the spell.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

9WgYnHqDFHWo4fRp.name: Evasion
9WgYnHqDFHWo4fRp.description: If Rumin rolls a success on a Reflex save, he gets a critical success instead.

gO9cUtoJfSHg4ICC.name: Susceptible to Mockery
gO9cUtoJfSHg4ICC.description:
A character can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} Rumin by mocking the fact that he hasn't yet been turned into a vampire. On a success, in addition to the normal effects, Rumin becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3} on a critical success), but on a critical failure he becomes enraged and gains a +1 status bonus to Strikes and damage rolls against foes for 1 minute, during which time he can't be mocked further.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.APJJCYdq4gNe0PF4]{Effect: Susceptible to Mockery (Critical Failure)}

dZ7gox9bINwa4OaH.description:
Rumin's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Umbraex.name: Umbraex
Umbraex.description: An umbraex appears at first glance to be a massive, majestic bird, much like a phoenix. Instead of compassion and warmth, however, it seethes with cold and hate. The umbraex is among the largest of the nihilistic undead called darvakkas.
Umbraex.npcHp: ashen rise, negative healing, regeneration 20 (deactivated by fire or good)

bbAMD3kYtYQ8Ro7M.name: Plane Shift (To Material Plane, Negative Energy Plane, or Shadow Plane Only)

frZzK6aHaPlfGXaG.name: Ashen Rise
frZzK6aHaPlfGXaG.description: When an umbraex is destroyed, its body discorporates into fine ash before being restored, fully healed, [[/r 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds} later. An umbraex can't use this ability as long as its remains are within an area consecrated to a good deity or an area of bright light. The umbraex can't use Ashen Rise again for 1 day.

XJj8TQj5hBV0uRCH.name: Entropy's Shadow
XJj8TQj5hBV0uRCH.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:40]{40 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Umbraex leak entropy and corruption from their very being. A living creature entering or starting its turn in the aura takes [[/r 8d6[negative]]] damage with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:42|basic:true]. If it fails, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and pulled 10 feet toward the vanyver.

nbnYt1tbPjDn1y06.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
nbnYt1tbPjDn1y06.description: An umbraex caught in sunlight is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}.

fUiV7MT5Xkn73xyb.name: Life-Siphoning Screech
fUiV7MT5Xkn73xyb.description:
The umbraex Flies, shrieking as it passes its enemies. Creatures within 20 feet of the umbraex's flight path take [[/r 22d6[mental]]] damage depending on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:45] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is drained 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Shadowbound Monk Statue.name: Shadowbound Monk Statue
Shadowbound Monk Statue.description:
As with any humanoid animated statues of Medium size, giant animated statues are used to guard locations of importance, but their increased size and power make them most useful in large vaults, spacious chambers, or outdoor locations. Animated objects of this strength and size are ideal for tasks and responsibilities usually performed by golems, and more powerful animated objects are thus all but unheard of.

Granted a semblance of life through the use of rituals or other strange magic, animated objects take many forms and serve a variety of uses. A few examples of typical animated objects are listed below. Many of these creatures serve as guardians, surprising unsuspecting adventurers when they suddenly attack. Others serve as idle distractions for the exceptionally rich, simple servants created to handle odd jobs, and the like.

FHYZijWKqxyPWq4b.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)
FHYZijWKqxyPWq4b.description: Like normal objects, the statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once the statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 24.

YoC3A5KlKj0hBnrB.name: Clinging Gloom
YoC3A5KlKj0hBnrB.description: The statue pulls a creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} into its grasping shadows. The target takes [[/r 3d8[negative]]] damage and [[/r 1d8[persistent,negative]]] damage.

MrDa1bcvphzw2x9Z.name: Cowl of Shadow
MrDa1bcvphzw2x9Z.description: Shifting shadows cover the statue. If the statue is dealt at least [[/r 15[positive]]] damage or brought within an area of magical light, the shadows recede, and the statue can't make darkness mote attacks or use Clinging Gloom.

mTghTKnayuIycwJ0.name: Sacrilegious Aura
mTghTKnayuIycwJ0.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

When a creature in the aura uses a positive spell or ability, Pokmit automatically attempts to counteract it, with a [[/r 1d20+29 #Counteract]]{+29} counteract modifier.

M8mWSrNnMsNwZzlQ.name: Devastating Blast
M8mWSrNnMsNwZzlQ.description: Pokmit unleashes a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of cold. Creatures in the area take [[/r 10d12[cold]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:40|basic:true]). The graveknight can use this ability once every [[/br 1d4 #Devastating Blast Recharge]]{1d4 rounds}.

wpdkohoMNWXtuIZQ.name: Graveknight's Curse
wpdkohoMNWXtuIZQ.description:
This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour.

Saving Throw @Check[type:will|dc:44] save

Onset 1 hour

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and can't remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, hampered 10, and can't remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 3 dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight

2ESchU6Js7pT2QaM.name: Pike Master
2ESchU6Js7pT2QaM.description: Pokmit's longspear reach increases by 5 feet until the start of his next turn, and he makes a single longspear Strike against any number of creatures. These attacks count toward Pokmit's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.

Nq1Qjxass8BueZBH.name: Pokmit's Discernment
Nq1Qjxass8BueZBH.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Pokmit sizes up the defenses of a creature within 30 feet; he must know the creature is near, but need not be able to see it. Until the start of Pokmit's next turn, Pokmit's attacks against the target ignore any flat check required due to the target being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}.

yByhPWWyLYMF0xPt.name: Ruinous Weapons
yByhPWWyLYMF0xPt.description: Any weapon or unarmed attack Pokmit uses gains the effects of the +1 greater striking and greater frost weapons runes. (These bonuses are included in his statistics above.)

FjGNo0QftZVw5ktJ.name: Weapon Master
FjGNo0QftZVw5ktJ.description: Pokmit has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons he wields.

Afziaka Brute.name: Afziaka Brute
Afziaka Brute.description:
An afziaka brute arises from a horse, bull, or other large animal.

Vrykolakas vampires use animals as tools to carry their spirits when they would otherwise be slain. The animal usually dies as the vampire is reborn, but some live on in painful starvation.

LP83nqMdxD5uhnwW.name: Grave-Bound Guts
LP83nqMdxD5uhnwW.description: While within 100 feet of its vrykolakas's burial ground, an afziaka appears in the natural shape it had when it was a regular animal and can eat normally. When farther away, it doesn't gain sustenance from eating food and eventually starves to death.

pyyhZ6BfNL9ATh0U.name: Hunger Pangs
pyyhZ6BfNL9ATh0U.description: A creature damaged by the afziaka's fangs must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 minute. The creature can remove this condition earlier by consuming at least a handful of raw meat.

Memory Hole.name: Blood Lords
Memory Hole.description: Anyone looking into the hole has memories sucked from their head.
Memory Hole.hazardDisable: @Check[type:deception|dc:29] (master) to feed the pit false thoughts that plug it, or @Check[type:occultism|dc:28] (expert) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th level; counteract DC 27) to drain the pit's magic
Memory Hole.hazardReset: The trap resets after 1 hour if it's not disabled.

Qs8jgNRG7timjSVE.name: Corpse Scent (Imprecise)
Qs8jgNRG7timjSVE.description: The ghoul crocodile can smell humanoid corpses in the water up to 1 mile away.

Vc4GNlil160ibq9a.name: Consume Flesh
Vc4GNlil160ibq9a.description:
Requirements The ghoul crocodile is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour

Effect The ghoul crocodile devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r 2d6[healing]]]{2d6 Hit Points}. It can regain HP from any given corpse only once.

JMxq3ADBC01HJnMz.name: Death Roll
JMxq3ADBC01HJnMz.description:
Requirements The ghoul crocodile must have a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The ghoul crocodile tucks its legs and rolls rapidly, twisting its victim. It makes a jaws Strike with a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll against the grabbed creature. If it hits, it also knocks the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If it fails, it releases the creature.

nrUiJF6RfQWNailR.name: Ghoul Fever
nrUiJF6RfQWNailR.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r 2d6[negative]]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r 2d6[negative]]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a ghoul the next midnight

JgSmuAF0Y7WGZqxZ.name: Paralysis
JgSmuAF0Y7WGZqxZ.description: Any living non-elf creature hit by a ghoul crocodile's tail must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Electrified Gate.name: Blood Lords
Electrified Gate.description: A warded metal gate electrocutes anyone who touches the gate without pressing the bypass button.
Electrified Gate.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:47] (legendary) to destroy the ward, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 47) to counteract the ward, or press the bypass button
Electrified Gate.hazardReset: The trap resets automatically if triggered, after 1 minute if the bypass button is pressed, or after 15 minutes if disabled or counteracted.

Iron Taviah.name: Iron Taviah
Iron Taviah.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

7Tej26wp3GwzSdpy.name: Coven
7Tej26wp3GwzSdpy.description: Iron Taviah adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.115Xp9E38CJENhNS]{Passwall}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.8Umt1AzYfFbC4fui]{Spellwrack} to her coven's spells.

ZTdFKmaD7Imp3Vkr.name: Magaambya Scar
ZTdFKmaD7Imp3Vkr.description: Taviah has an old injury that sometimes causes her pain. A physical attack on Taviah that scores a critical hit exacerbates the injury in her wounded leg; in addition to the other effects of the critical hit, Taviah is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

ICF4eC8QzWpKC81e.name: Bonds of Iron
ICF4eC8QzWpKC81e.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Iron Taviah can cause a cage built of cold iron fingernails to spring from nothingness around a target at a range of up to 30 feet, attempting an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} against the target's Fortitude DC; if the target has a weakness to cold iron, Taviah gains a +2 circumstance bonus to this check. Unlike a normal Grapple, Taviah doesn't need to be within reach and can move as she pleases, and a successful attempt lasts until the creature Escapes (DC 24), causing the cage to crumble into rust. Any creature can attempt to destroy the cage by attacking it; the cage has an AC of 19, Hardness 10, and 40 Hit Points.

ETaugj7PvAqfMfFY.description:
Iron Taviah can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed, or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

aPjHCeJ7PdtCACQB.name: Ritual Specialist
aPjHCeJ7PdtCACQB.description: Iron Taviah has a +2 circumstance bonus to the primary checks to perform a ritual. In addition, she can reduce the number of secondary casters for a ritual by 1. When she does, she must fulfill any requirements for the secondary caster, and she attempts the secondary check normally performed by that secondary caster. She can't replace a secondary caster who is the target of the spell (as in the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.7Fd4lxozd11MQ55N]{Atone} ritual).

E6CK2SNJqqGlCXkQ.name: Scattered Coven
E6CK2SNJqqGlCXkQ.description: When the characters meet Iron Taviah, the Graveclaw is at the height of its power. As a scattered coven, the Graveclaw grants Taviah the ability to cast the following spells as 3rd-level occult spells, once per day each, without requiring help from her fellow coven members:@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.f8hRqLJaxBVhF1u0]{Acid Arrow}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.B3eLlbaPxOYHcs1o]{Curse Of Lost Time}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.xlRv8vCTHh1NeMpw]{Mimic Undead}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Seaah9amXg70RKw2]{Water Walk}.

UIRxk8ZQIc88MUzh.name: Overwhelming Ectoplasm
UIRxk8ZQIc88MUzh.description: An ectoplasmic amalgam's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a ghost touch property rune. A creature damaged by an ectoplasmic amalgam's Strikes is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} unless they succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36] save, as the thoughts and emotions of the amalgam's constituent souls invade their mind.

6PugTFezx0IQVLSv.name: Pummeling Barrage
6PugTFezx0IQVLSv.description: The ectoplasmic amalgam attempts a melee Strike against each enemy within the amalgam's melee reach. Each attack counts toward the amalgam's multiple attack penalty but don't increase the amalgam's penalty until it has made all its attacks.

KuQ5KZzju8qEC4Is.name: Spew Ectoplasm
KuQ5KZzju8qEC4Is.description: The ectoplasmic amalgam releases a burst of ectoplasm that deals [[/r 16d6[bludgeoning]]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:36|basic:true]). On a failed save, a creature is additionally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} on a critical failure). Spew Ectoplasm functions as a force effect for the purposes of affecting incorporeal creatures. The ectoplasmic amalgam can't use Spew Ectoplasm again for [[/r 1d4 #Spew Ectoplasm Recharge]]{1d4 rounds}.
